title: Senior Java Developer
description:
Java Developer – AWS & DevOps Focus
  
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Java Developer with deep expertise in AWS and DevOps practices to join an innovative team working on cutting-edge solutions in the automotive tech space.
  
This role is ideal for someone who is proactive, collaborative, and eager to learn. You’ll be part of a dynamic environment where curiosity, knowledge sharing, and personal ownership are highly valued. The team is working closely with international partners and is focused on building impactful services connected to future vehicle technologies.
  
The position offers a blend of technical challenge and team engagement—with regular in-office days, planning events with international stakeholders, and a strong team culture that includes shared lunches, social gatherings, and close cooperation with sister teams.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Develop, maintain, and optimize backend services using Java
  
Build and manage serverless applications in AWS
  
Integrate and work with DevOps tools and pipelines to ensure efficient delivery and monitoring
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and international technology partners
  
Participate in planning sessions, both onsite and during travel to customer locations (e.g., Germany)
  
Take full ownership of your work, contributing to a reliable and high-performing system
  
  

Required Qualifications
  
Solid experience in Java backend development
  
Extensive hands-on knowledge of AWS, particularly serverless solutions
  
Familiarity with modern DevOps tools and methodologies
  
Strong problem-solving abilities and ability to work independently
  
Excellent communication and team collaboration skills
  
Fluency in English
  
  

Desirable Skills
  
Basic knowledge of Python is a plus
  
  

Additional Details
  
**Hybrid work model:** Minimum 2 days/week onsite with the team
  
Occasional travel to Germany for planning events
  
Assignment is ongoing—early applications are encouraged as the role may close before the final date
  
  

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a forward-looking environment where technology meets mobility innovation. If you're looking for a role where you can make a tangible impact while working with modern cloud-native technologies, this could be the perfect fit.
  
  

About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Utvecklare inom .NET – För dig som brinner för teknik och samhällsnytta
description:
### **Vill du jobba i gränslandet mellan teknik, samhällsnytta och kundlösningar? Just nu söker vi en erfaren .NET-utvecklare till** **MEAplus** **– ett techbolag i Malmö som utvecklar säkra, smarta IT-tjänster för både privat och offentlig sektor.**


Här får du en bred roll där du arbetar nära teknik, drift och kund i ett prestigelöst team, med **stor frihet under ansvar** och goda möjligheter att påverka.

### **Om rollen**


Som utvecklare inom .NET kommer du att bli en viktig nyckelspelare i ett team där nyutveckling, drift och problemlösning går hand i hand. Ena dagen skapar du ny funktionalitet för en offentlig aktör, andra dagen felsöker du tillsammans med driftteamet. Du får ta stort tekniskt ansvar och samtidigt bidra till hur Sveriges digitalisering formas.

 **Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**

* Utveckla smarta funktioner och kundanpassade lösningar med .NET och C#
* Felsöka, analysera och förbättra systemen tillsammans med kollegor
* Bygga vidare på lösningar inom certifikat, säkerhet och integrationer
* Arbeta med tekniker som RabbitMQ, MariaDB och krypteringslösningar
* Delta i förbättringsarbete, testning och implementation i SaaS-miljö

### **Om dig**


Vi söker dig som är trygg i din roll som utvecklare och som gillar att kombinera teknik med problemlösning och kundnytta. Du är nyfiken, självgående och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap i teamet.

 **Vi ser gärna att du har:**

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i .NET-miljö
* Gedigna kunskaper i C# och databaser
* Ett tydligt teknikintresse – gärna med hobbyprojekt eller GitHub-profil
* Erfarenhet av RabbitMQ, MariaDB eller säkerhet/certifikat är meriterande
* En prestigelös och lösningsorienterad inställning

**Plats:** Malmö

**Start:** Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid

  

Om MEAplus (kundföretaget)


MEAplus är ett växande techbolag med bas i Malmö. De utvecklar applikationer, driftar IT-miljöer och levererar lösningar som förenklar vardagen för kunder inom både företag och offentlig sektor.


Hos MEAplus jobbar man nära tekniken och nära kund – med fokus på säkerhet, innovation och samhällsnytta. Miljön är dynamisk och prestigelös, med korta beslutsvägar och stort utrymme för egna initiativ.

### **Ansökan**


Vårt Talent Acquisition-team ser gärna att du skickar in ett uppdaterat CV där du tydligt beskriver din tekniska bakgrund och tidigare erfarenhet. Vi intervjuar löpande, så visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt. Vid frågor, kontakta **maria@linden-it.se**.

title: Azure Developer
description:
Join Dustin’s integration team and take charge of driving innovation as you work with cutting-edge Azure technologies to shape the future of our cloud solutions. If you're passionate about Azure, integrations, and making an impact through technology, this is the opportunity for you.

**This is what makes the position as Azure Developer unique**

* Drive innovation with the latest Azure technologies in a key role shaping Dustin’s cloud-first transformation.


* Take the lead and inspire others by coaching and sharing your expertise within integrations and modern cloud architecture.


* Unleash your creativity in a tech-driven team where your ideas and initiatives truly make an impact.

  

The hiring manager for the role is **Sara Wennerström, Director of Application Management.** She believes that successful work is built on initiative, engagement, and a solid understanding of business processes and system support. As a leader, she is open, attentive, and committed to setting goals together with the team to achieve collective success.

  

The integration development team is close-knit, where members consistently support one another, balancing focused work time from home with two fixed office days each week, dedicated to collaboration and enjoying early lunches together.  

  

***Read more about Dustin here***

 **Your role & influence as Azure Developer**

*Responsibility*: You will be given responsibility for integration development in Azure, including designing solution architectures for new requirements and driving process improvements as an informal leader within the team.  

  

*Collaboration*: Together with your team, you take care of integration development between standard applications, build APIs for external customers, and continuously maintain and improve the team’s solutions. You'll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with other developers across Technology and a wide range of internal and external stakeholders around Dustin.  

  

*Core activities:*

* Develop and implement integration solutions using Azure technologies like Logic Apps, Azure Functions, and Service Bus.


* Design solution architectures for new integration requirements and recommend the best technical approaches.


* Collaborate with the team to maintain and improve existing BizTalk solutions, while coaching and sharing knowledge with colleagues in the Azure and integration space.



**Benefits of joining Dustin**


We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.

  


**You can find more on our benefits below in the vacancy.**

**This is what we imagine you bring**


We envision you as a curious and driven individual passionate about cutting-edge technology, eager to lead and mentor, and skilled at driving innovative solutions. We expect that you bring solid senior experience in Azure Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, and Cosmos DB, with a strong background in leading teams, implementing new processes, and solution architecture.

 *Additionally, it'll be nice if you bring:*

  

* A bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* Experience with APIM, Biztalk
* Proficiency in Swedish.

**What can you expect next?**


To ensure a fair recruitment process free from unconscious bias, we handle your application anonymously and do not accept cover letters. Please refrain from sending one, so that the selection is based solely on professional competencies. We expect the following steps in the recruitment process:

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu.
* First interview with the Hiring Manager, Sara Wennerström.
* Technical (Second) interview with three future colleagues from the team.
* Professional References.

**Read more about how to become a** **Dustineer**


For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via e-mail: karishma.sindhu@dustin.com**.**
company_description: We are a leading online-based IT partner in the Nordics and the Benelux. We are in constant movement and with that comes many opportunities for us to develop and grow together. Are you ready to join?

title: Software Engineer/Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a key member of our team, you'll design, develop, and maintain backend solutions for our Stores. Working in an agile environment, you'll collaborate with product managers, business and frontend engineers to deliver high-quality, scalable software. The ideal candidate is passionate about backend development, proficient in C# and .Net, and stays updated with Microsoft Development best practices.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 
  

  

* API Design: Collaborating on the design and implementation of APIs that facilitate seamless communication between the Mobile Application and backend, ensuring an efficient flow of data in the headless ecommerce environment.
* Databases (SQL/ NoSQL): Contributing to data modelling and database design, optimizing storage and retrieval mechanisms to align with the requirements of a headless ecommerce architecture.
* Azure Cloud: Leveraging your expertise in Azure Cloud services to enhance the scalability, reliability, and performance of our backend systems, ensuring a seamless integration with our headless ecommerce applications.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 At Store Lens, we work closely with Portfolio Brands and H&M Brand to design and provide technical solutions. We contribute to product development at every stage, from setting requirements to rollout and testing. From day one, we focus on improving by listening, building, and refining as we go. Even as we define requirements, we are already thinking ahead, using early designs, first developments, and new learnings to continuously make the product better.
   

  

 We are curious, active listeners and hands-on doers.
   

  

 Beyond your work with Store Lens, you will also be part of our Engineering/QA community, where you will have access to a network of experts, resources, and opportunities to grow.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience), and at least 5-8 years of experience as a Software Engineer with backend focus.
* Proficiency in C# and .NET.
* Proficiency in Azure concepts and native development using Azure functions.
* Experience in concept as Always up and message queuing.
* Experience of CI/ CD pipelines using Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions.
* Experience of containerization technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
* Experience in Database (e.g. Cosmos Db).
* Experience in POS, Payment and Checkout area is a plus.
* Experience in SignalR is a plus.


*And people who have:*
* Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in backend testing.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience conducting code reviews, identifying areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Familiarity in backend testing with a focus on ensuring the reliability and performance of backend systems.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Bannerflow is a hyper-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. We build a Creative Management Platform that allows enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze, and optimize advertising in-house, at scale and across advertising channels.
   

  

 Our agile teams are highly autonomous, collaborative and we are now looking for yet another passionate engineer to join us!
   

  

 ⭐ Ready for a new challenge? Here is what we offer.
   

  

* Flexible & autonomous teams, built upon trust. Together, we decide how to win. We trust, assume the best in others, and respect the individual, which we believe is the foundation of our great engineering culture. Our teams consistently score high in motivation and engagement measurements. We believe in close collaboration and communication, within and outside of the team.
* New challenges and personal growth. We live by our entrepreneurial spirit, this means taking risks, identifying opportunities and always seeking new solutions.
* A passionate and fun culture. We are passionate about our work and believe that having lots of fun is essential for both creativity and success. Welcome to a diverse and inclusive workplace, with a lot of fun and exciting activities going on including hackathons, team activities, company trips and board game nights.
* A stable and global industry-leader based in Stockholm, expanding and scaling to new markets! We’re in a great position to drive success and seize new opportunities, our international customer base is constantly growing and so is our product. With the support of our new owners, we are making moves to expand into new markets, setting a clear course for growth in 2025.
* Constantly evolving tech and modern tooling. Our creative management platform serves 500+ million impressions every day (with a record of over 1 billion). We are constantly looking to improve our product and tech. Do you have ideas on how we can scale even faster? Bring them on!


**🥁** 
 What tech makes you heart beat?
   

  

**Our Ever Evolving Tech Stack Currently Consists Of**
* TypeScript / Angular
* C# / .NET
* MongoDB
* Azure & Kubernetes
* …and some more stuff


 🦋 Are you + Bannerflow = true?
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced and ambitious engineer to join our team and help us continue to deliver the best possible products to our customers. This role is a critical part of our development team and will play a key role in shaping the direction of our technology and ensuring that our products are robust, scalable and secure.
   

  

 So, what are we looking for?
   

  

* >5 years of experience as a software engineer delivering high-quality products
* Strong sense of ownership and personal drive
* Ability to write clean, efficient, and well-documented code
* Excellent communication, collaboration and leadership skills - paring or mobbing fellow developer is just a natural way of working for you
* Passion for mentoring and coaching team members to help them reach their full potential
* Strong interest of the latest technologies, industry trends and best practices to continually improve our products and processes


 At Bannerflow, we live by our values of passion, collaboration, and challenge. As a Software Engineer you’ll help us continue to revolutionize the Ad Tech industry through cutting-edge technology and product excellence. We offer a hybrid workplace and a competitive compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health care insurance. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.
   

  

 If you are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you!

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer - Hybrid - Stockholm
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.

* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Full-stack developer (banking)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Consultant and Full-stack Developer, you will design, develop, and maintain front-end and back-end components of applications. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will deliver high-quality software solutions that meet business objectives. This client-facing role requires understanding and aligning with client needs. Your responsibilities include developing and maintaining web applications, ensuring code quality and performance, collaborating on new features, and staying current with industry trends and technologies.
   

  

**Your profile**
* 5+ years of experience as a Full-stack Developer.
* Proficiency in front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React or Angular.
* Understanding of back-end technologies such as Node.js, Python or .NET.
* Problem-solving and debugging skills.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Previous consulting or client service delivery experience is beneficial.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* We keep everyone connected, with learning activities and social events. With the freedom to grow, you get access to a wide range of our global comprehensive training programs.
* We focus on inclusion and embrace and empower talent in all its diverse forms and origins.
* We are valuing work-life balance with flexible working arrangements in order for you to balance your work life with your personal life.


**Application**
 Don’t hesitate to send in your application. We will be interviewing continuously and look forward to finding our next colleague.
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: SENIOR DEVELOPER
description:
**Senior Developer**
**Scandinavian Airlines’ Loyalty Solutions team at SAS Digital & IT is looking for one Senior Developer to be part of driving our development roadmap within one of our feature teams: EuroBonus Commercial Development.**
 We just started our next exciting chapter of developing the next generation products and services for our more than 8 million EuroBonus members, as well as migrating all our current services from one techstack to another – the nextgen web of SAS.
   

  

 To further accelerate this journey we are looking for 1 Senior Developer to bring further energy, competence and skills to our team.
   

  

**Challenges You Will Work On**
* Support our Digital product owners to plan the team sprints to keep it aligned with our prioritized backlog.
* Take lead in code review for the team of developers working in the feature team, as well as performing pair-programming with more junior developers to help them advance in their development efforts.
* Support Tech lead and other senior developers in the department to analyse and perform solution design of new products and services, as well as refactor current ones.
* Understand needs from business and translate them into working software. This role requires strong communication skills, as you will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across different teams to ensure alignment and successful implementation of solutions.
* Secure application compliance with regulation (GDPR, Accessibility) and SAS IT security.
* Understand when and how to make performance optimizations and trade-offs
* Design architecture and solutions based on MVP model that can scale to enterprise solutions.
* Proactively suggest digital solutions that can help the organization meet its goals
* Be part of our on-call rotation together with our entire DevOps-team securing our services are running stable 24/7.


**To Be Successful, We Believe You Have**
* Strong understanding of how to build modern web applications using JavaScript/TypeScript and libraries/frameworks such as React, Next.js and Node.js. (Web + BFF)
* Experience working with monorepo architectures, including tools like Turborepo, and best practices for scaling and maintainability. (Monorepo + scaling + maintainer)
* A passion for creating and enhancing the developer experience, including building intuitive APIs, improving documentation, and streamlining workflows for developers.
* A passion for proposing and driving change in a complex technical environment, and to share knowledge through demos, presentations, and other forums.
* Comfortable with cloud infrastructure, preferably within Azure.
* Strong familiarity with Agile practices.
* Proficiency in English.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar field, or work experience valued equally.
* 5+ years in senior commercial IT-development role(s).


**Beneficial;**
* Experience from developing products and services for a loyalty program, such as other airline loyalty programs, hotel loyalty programs etc.
* Experience from Okta auth0 technology.
* Experience from integration with other vendors and partners to drive product innovation and revenue.
* Experience in CI/CD pipelines, Github, and infrastructure automation.
* Expertise in feature development, with a focus on scalable, maintainable, and accessible solutions.
* Experience working with monorepo workflows, including tooling and best practices that support team collaboration and scalability.


**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


**Other Of Importance**
* Deadline for application: 25/04/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR.
* Desired startdate: As soon as possible.
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period.
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need a EU-work permit.

title: Junior Software Engineer - Partner Fullfilment Solutions (Lionel)
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**THE ROLE & THE TEAM**
 At ZEOS, Zalando's B2B Logistics unit, we're building Europe's leading Logistics Platform. We've learned that solving fulfillment-related challenges benefits our customers and fuels our platform's growth. As we welcome more partners to our ecosystem, we're developing tailored fulfillment services to meet their diverse needs.
   

  

 Join us as a Junior Software Engineer and be part of a collaborative team designing innovative technical solutions. You'll connect various e-commerce platforms with ZEOS's robust logistics ecosystem, ensuring smooth operations across warehousing, inventory management, deliveries, and returns.
   

  

 As a Junior Software Engineer at Zalando, you'll be joining a pan-European powerhouse with over 50 million active users across multiple countries. This unique position offers you an unparalleled opportunity to bootstrap your career in tech. You'll gain exposure to large-scale systems, diverse markets, and cutting-edge technologies, all while working on solutions that impact millions of customers daily. The experience and skills you'll acquire here will serve as a robust foundation for your future career growth, whether you aspire to be a technical expert or a team leader.
   

  

 We value your unique perspective and offer an inclusive environment where you can thrive and make a significant impact. You'll have the opportunity to learn about the broad business landscape we operate in, bringing visibility and transparency to processes that directly affect our customers and key stakeholders.
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
* Collaborate with a diverse team to apply the best software engineering practices.
* The team is responsible for the design, development, deployment, operation, and improvement of software solutions that directly impact our daily business interactions with our partners. At Zalando, we adhere to the "you write it, you run it" philosophy, empowering the team to take full ownership of the entire operation.
* Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on AWS.
* Working like a startup in an agile environment & taking ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation & maintenance. Write applications from scratch with the latest technologies free of your choice.
* Contribute to shaping an inclusive culture and fostering a diverse team environment


**WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF**
* You have 1+ years of software engineering experience.
* You have a good understanding of microservice architecture, REST services and API implementation.
* You're skilled in Java or Kotlin development (experience with Spring Boot is a plus)
* You have knowledge of relational databases and cloud architectures/platforms
* You demonstrate strong ownership, creative thinking, and excellent communication skills


****OUR OFFER****
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

  

****INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN****
 At Zalando, our vision is to be the leading pan-European ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle e-commerce - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.
   

  

 We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.
   

  

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-culture/diversity-and-inclusion

title: Software Engineer (.NET Core) - Hybrid - Stockholm Or Malmö Or Madrid
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our backend systems leverage the latest C# and .NET Core technologies, deployed in Kubernetes on AWS. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and crafting scalable, reliable systems that power seamless communication worldwide.
   

  

 This role is a hybrid role and is open to candidates located in Stockholm or Malmo or Madrid.
   

  

 If you're a Software Engineer with a passion for problem-solving, clean code, and modern DevOps practices, we'd love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Software Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Major professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Proficiency in additional programming languages such as C++, Python, or Kotlin
* Experience with Asterisk and VoIP protocols, preferably SIP.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
   

  

 Please send your application in English language. Thank you!

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Our mission** 




 At SkimSafe, we build innovative cybersecurity products that make everyday life more secure. Since our launch in 2020, we’ve grown rapidly – and we’re just getting started.
 



  





**Ambitious? So are we** 




 We’re a tight-knit, fast-growing team with big ambitions, bringing together a wide range of skills in software development, fraud prevention, customer support, communication, and sales. What unites us is a shared mission: to make the internet a safer place for everyone.
 



  





**Open position: Senior full stack developer** 




 Right now, we’re looking for a senior full stack developer on site at our Stockholm office. You will work closely with our CTO Philip Manmnheimer and be part of a team that values curiosity, critical thinking and impact.
 



  





**Job description** 




 Over the past five years, we have developed a sophisticated multi-application architecture within EKS Kubernetes Clusters. We continuously monitor technological advancements and new developments to further enhance our products. Our team operates with a lean methodology and a flat hierarchy, maintaining a minimalist approach to meetings to maximize our time dedicated to what we love doing: coding.
 



 The main languages that we mainly work with are:
 


* Elixir with Phoenix LiveView
* Rust



 Note that we have other fundamental languages that we work with, but assume you know them.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 5+ years of work experience with at least one of the main languages that we work with:
 


* PostgreSQL
* MySQL
* Bonus
* EKS Kubernetes
* Github Actions



  





**What we offer** 




 Beyond a competitive salary and generous stock options, you will be a crucial and valued member of our growing team at SkimSafe. Unlike larger organizations, you won’t be treated as just another component. You’ll have significant opportunities for professional development, learning new skills, and tackling both immediate and long-term challenges as our company expands.
 



  





 If you want to be part of our journey and make a leap in your career, please send an email to philip@skimsafe.se.
 



  





 We are always looking for the right people so we’d love for you to come over and have a coffee, even if the right position isn’t available at the moment.

title: Software Engineers to Zalando
description:
**About The Company And The Role**
 We are looking for two Software Engineers to join Zalando, an international e-commerce company that is shaping the future of retail. This company provides a platform that serves millions of customers worldwide and is now expanding its engineering team to continue delivering innovative solutions. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with technologies such as Java, Kotlin, AWS, PostgreSQL, and Elasticsearch, all while collaborating with passionate teams focused on driving innovation.
   

  

 In the role of Software Engineer, you’ll develop and operate large-scale systems that ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment. Your primary focus will be to build backend applications that handle high volumes of data and deliver seamless experiences for customers and partners.
   

  

 At Zalando, you’ll be part of a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. This role offers you the chance to contribute to an innovative, customer-centric organization that is reshaping the future of online retail.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Developing and maintaining high-performance, low-latency systems for data streaming and processing.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and scale solutions for fulfillment and customer experience.
* Taking ownership of applications, managing them from development through deployment and monitoring.
* Innovating and finding solutions to scale the platform in an increasingly complex ecosystem.
* Actively contributing to the development of new features and improvements.


 You’ll contribute to Zalando’s success by ensuring the systems you build directly enhance the customer experience. As a Software Engineer, you’ll be challenged by the complexity of building distributed systems at scale and will have the opportunity to collaborate across teams and countries.
   

  

**We Believe You Have**
* A relevant degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* 3-6 years of professional experience in software engineering.
* Solid experience with Java or Kotlin and building APIs.
* Familiarity with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and event-driven architectures.
* Some experience or interest in AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch.
* A passion for problem-solving and building scalable solutions.
* Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken).


**It’s a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Kubernetes) and distributed systems.
* Knowledge of Kafka or similar messaging systems.
* Experience working with large-scale, high-availability systems.


 We are looking for candidates who are proactive, innovative, and motivated to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
   

  

 Other information
   

  

 Start date: As soon as possible
   

  

 Scope: Full-time position (100%)
   

  

 Location: Stockholm.
   

  

 Selection process: We apply continuous selection, which means the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, feel free to contact the responsible recruiter Ronja Bergman on ronja.bergman@techtalents.se
   

  

 Does this sound like the position for you? We look forward to hearing from you – warmly welcome with your application!
   

  

 In this recruitment, Zalando is collaborating with Tech Talents, and we direct applications to Tech Talents.

title: Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 DICE is a creative studio with offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg. We believe in the power of diversity and welcome game creators from all backgrounds to collaborate with us as we unlock the potential for the future of Battlefield!
   

  

 We're always pushing to be at the forefront of creative entertainment - blending digital art, design, and technology to push boundaries. Our collaborative culture is fueled by passion, driving innovation and making a positive difference for our players and community.
   

  

 At DICE, your ideas matter. We offer an inclusive space where you can thrive, be yourself, and grow alongside a team dedicated to making a meaningful impact to the world of gaming.
   

  

 We're all-in on the future and our most ambitious Battlefield yet. Want to be part of something special? Read on.
   

  

**The Role**
 We believe that to provide the best possible experience for our players we need the best tools possible!
   

  

 As a
 *Fullstack Engineer* 
 at Foundational Tech(FT) Online, you will design, implement and maintain internal web-based tools that will be used by our Live team to engage with millions of our players across the globe, dynamically changing the gameplay experience, progression, in-game store, matchmaking and many other aspects of our games. You will report into a
 *Development Director* 
 .
   

  

 FT Online works in small teams that collaborate to create online solutions for our games, using modern technologies and frameworks deployed to a cloud-based infrastructure. You will integrate with multiple existing systems; some developed in-house and some by external parties. You will work with many different teams within EA.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with stakeholders (e.g. game design, UX, product and analytics teams) to identify and fulfill online game design needs
* Analyze, design, specify and implement game design features/solutions
* Work in an agile engineering team - writing well designed, testable, maintainable and scalable code
* Be part of technical architecture discussions and help guide technical decisions within the team
* Drive continuous improvement of software quality, customer experience, and maintainability of products/features


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in TypeScript, including an understanding of concepts like closures, asynchronous programming, state management and dependency injection patterns
* 5+ years of experience working on web projects applying modern web development best practices, from UI in the front-end to micro-services and cloud services in the back end
* Experience with continuous integration and delivery
* Experience developing distributed, resilient, and scalable back-end systems using Scala, Java, or other JVM language
* Write clear / concise maintainable, testable (unit & integration testing) code


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with React and Mobx.
* Experience with Kubernetes or other container-orchestration systems.
* Experience with cloud services.
* Experience with functional languages (e.g. Scala)
* Contributions to Open-Source projects.


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Software engineer
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll* 
*.*
 Just nu rekryterar vi in fler medarbetare till en avdelning som levererar ledningssystem både till det svenska flygvapnet och till kunder utomlands. Vi erbjuder en avslappnad och informell kultur med högt i tak där du främst kommer arbeta med vidareutveckling av befintlig mjukvara. Det inkluderar utveckling av nya funktioner, förbättring av befintliga funktioner, åtgärda buggar, etc. I arbetet ingår både resor och kundkontakter.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Du har ett stort intresse för programmering och minst 7 års arbetslivserfarenhet som utvecklare. Du brinner för att lära dig mer och ständigt bli bättre. Om du är intresserad av flyg och militär är det en stor fördel. En högskole- eller universitetsutbildning med inriktning på datateknik eller motsvarande är ett krav.
   

  

 Vi ser problemlösningsförmåga som en viktig egenskap. Det går sällan att googla sig fram till lösningar och du kommer ibland stöta på problem som innebär att du själv måste söka upp personer med relevant expertis och skapa dig en förståelse för hur du kan lösa problemet.
   

  

 Eftersom du kommer att arbeta självständigt och i nära samarbete med kunden är det viktigt att du är drivande, utåtriktad och villig att ta ansvar. Du har en positiv grundsyn, har god samarbetsförmåga och har lätt för att kommunicera. Vi jobbar i en internationell miljö vilket gör det viktigt att du, utöver svenska, även behärskar engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Du kommer att arbeta med flera olika verktyg och programmeringsspråk. I nuläget används till största del Ada (backend) och Java (frontend), men du kommer även stöta på Python och Bash, och kanske C och C++. Det är en fördel om du i dina tidigare jobb arbetat i flera olika språk. Om du kan Java och/eller Ada är det meriterande, men inget krav. Du kommer att jobba i en Linuxmiljö och använda Git. Du kommer troligtvis att stöta på programmeringsspråk, verktyg, ramverk och miljöer som du inte är familjär med, och det är då viktigt att du är ivrig att lära dig det som behövs.
   

  

 Du behöver uppfylla samtliga krav för att vara aktuell för den här tjänsten, men var inte rädd för att söka även om du inte uppfyller de meriterande punkterna.
   

  

**Krav**
* Du har goda färdigheter i minst två programmeringsspråk
* Du har goda kunskaper i hur versionshantering fungerar (Git/CVS/etc.)
* Du har minst grundläggande kunskaper i hur man arbetar agilt (Scrum/Kanban)
* Du har minst grundläggande kunskaper i Linux
* Du har goda kunskaper i engelska och svenska, både i tal och skrift
* Du är inte rädd för att ta kontakt med människor för att lösa problem
* Du har en högskoleutbildning med inriktning på datateknik, eller motsvarande


**Meriterande**
* Du är intresserad av flyg och/eller militär
* Du har militär erfarenhet, eller erfarenhet av försvarsindustrin
* Du har kunskaper i Java och/eller Ada
* Du har kunskaper i olika byggsystem (Jenkins, Make, etc.)
* Du har kunskaper i virtualisering, nätverk och IT-säkerhet
* Du är van vid att arbeta i flera olika programmeringsspråk/ramverk


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Vad blir du en del av?**
 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner som du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa om dem här

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**🚦 Senior Fullstack utvecklare med fokus på Frontend och Power BI.** 




 Vi söker dig som är en skicklig och trygg Data Engineer med
 **fokus på Power BI och frontend** 
 , redo att ta dig an ett viktigt och samhällsnyttigt uppdrag inom
 **kollektivtrafik, ekonomi och HR-data** 
 . Du blir
 **anställd av LetsGig AB** 
 och uthyrd till en offentlig aktör med hög teknisk mognad och ett brett uppdrag som gynnar hundratusentals människor varje dag.
 



  





 🟡
 **Om uppdraget** 
 Du kommer arbeta i ett erfaret team av Data Engineers där du fokuserar på att:
 


* Modellera data i guldlager och semantiska modeller
* Möjliggöra och stötta verksamheten i självbetjäningslösningar
* Utbilda användare i Power BI samt presentera modeller och rapporter
* Ibland ta fram prototyper och rapporter själv



 💡 Det finns möjlighet att arbeta med förbättring av analysförmåga inom trafikdata – ett plus om du redan gjort det!
 



 📍
 **Placering** 
 : Hybrid i Stockholm
 



 📆
 **Period** 
 : 25 april – 31 december 2025 (med option på förlängning upp till 2 år)
 



 ⏰
 **Omfattning** 
 : 100% (40h/vecka)
 



  





  





**✅ Kvalifikationer (obligatoriska krav)** 




 För att kunna komma i fråga krävs att du uppfyller följande:
 


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av organisationsövergripande BI- och analyslösningar
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av:
* ETL/ETL-pipeline-utveckling
* Datamodellering



  





 Erfarenhet från:
 


* Microsoft Azure (inklusive Synapse/Fabric)
* Power BI (semantisk modellering, användarvänlig rapportutveckling)
* CI/CD
* Jira
* Agila arbetssätt
* Prototyping för rapporter
* Utbildning/stöd till self-service BI-användare
* Lakehouse-arkitektur



  





  





**⭐ Extra plus (mervärdeskrav)** 



* Erfarenhet av arbete med trafikdata
* Erfarenhet från offentlig sektor eller liknande styrda organisationer
* Har förbättrat dataanalysförmåga inom trafikområdet



  





  





**💼 Om anställningen** 




 Du blir
 **anställd av Let's Gig** 
 och får ett attraktivt upplägg som anställd konsult –
 **vi söker alltså inte underkonsulter** 
 . Vi sköter allt det administrativa så att du kan fokusera på det du är bäst på. För rätt person kan detta leda till fler spännande och samhällsviktiga uppdrag framåt.
 



  





  





 🔍
 **Sök nu** 
 Skicka CV och kort beskrivning av hur du uppfyller kraven – gärna med referenser till tidigare uppdrag. Tjänsten tillsätts så snart rätt person är identifierad, så vänta inte!
 



 📧 Ansök via LinkedIn eller maila direkt till martin@letsgig.se

title: Software Engineer Typescript (Frontend Mid/Senior), Remote
description:
Everything we do is powered by our customers! Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a connected experience that our customers anticipate, transforming marketing, merchandising, and operations with commerce tools designed to scale with fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by curiosity, creativity, and collaboration to power 5,000+ global brands.
   

  

 Driven by a customer-first mentality, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.
   

  

 Become a part of Maropost today and help shape the future of commerce!
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are looking for an open minded and enthusiastic mid level engineer to join our team. If you are interested in developing and maintaining a mature product that millions of people use daily, we would love to meet you! We are a product driven team, and we’re looking for someone who loves to be engaged in the product development process and appreciates being able to deliver an outcome without depending on other engineers.
   

  

 The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET ( +/-2 hours).
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* As a software engineer, focusing primarily on the frontend on our team, you'll be working with other engineers to further develop and architect our search and merchandizing as a service product.
* On the frontend we have our main backoffice dashboard written in vue.js and we develop and maintain integrations for our customers ecommerce stores as a react based SDK and more recently also packaged natively for specific platforms such as Shopify.
* The TypeScript backend is responsible for several microservices, from managing the product configuration to integration with various platforms. The main database is PostgreSQL, and we also use cool tech such as Apache Pulsar.
* We’re an empowered product team, firmly committed to collaborative problem solving. We write specs and share the decision making. We work in two week sprints to deliver greatness.
* Designing and writing maintainable, readable and elegant code, rearchitecting and refactoring existing software where needed
* Contributing to technical and product specs, and collaborating on architecture and design decisions together with the other stakeholders
* Embracing feedback on your specs and your code as an opportunity for continuous improvement and collaborative design, and carrying out spec and code review for your coworkers
* Testing the software you build for reliability and robustness using different testing paradigms and libraries


**What You'll Bring To Maropost**
* Have at least 3 year’s experience with frontend frameworks/libraries (VueJS)
* Have experience vanilla TypeScript, HTML, and CSS. Ability to manipulate the DOM, understand event-driven programming and build responsive web applications is a strong plus.
* Have some experience with backend javascript frameworks (we use Node/Express, Node/Nest with TypeScript)
* Appreciate well-designed APIs and can contribute to their design (REST or GraphQL, we use both)
* Understands modern cloud native infrastructure (we use AWS/GCP)
* Appreciate good developer experience and make ours even better by introducing new tools and iterating on processes
* Are generous with your communication, whether it is about new ideas, praise, or very kindly phrased constructive feedback
* Like to learn new things, have an open mind and want to share your knowledge with your coworkers
* Are an effective technical and non-technical communicator (our company language is English)


 Equal Employment Opportunist
   

  

 Maropost is deeply committed to promoting diversity, advancing equity and fostering a culture of inclusion. Therefore, we invite applications from marginalized and equity-seeking groups. Individuals seeking employment at Maropost are considered without regards to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, age, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or veteran status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please feel free to reach out to the recruitment team for any accommodation requests or questions.

title: Senior Mobile Developer (Frontend)
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Senior Frontend/Mobile Engineer, you'll ensure seamless and engaging experiences across smartphones, PCs, and other devices. Experience with multiple device types, payments, and iOS is highly valued. While Kotlin is the main language, JavaScript and TypeScript are also useful. Your work will cover POS sales, payments, back-office applications, mobile payments, self-checkout stations, and standout in-store payment solutions.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 At Storelens, we work closely with Portfolio Brands and H&M Brand to design and provide technical solutions. We contribute to product development at every stage, from setting requirements to rollout and testing. From day one, we focus on improving by listening, building, and refining as we go. Even as we define requirements, we are already thinking ahead, using early designs, first developments, and new learnings to continuously make the product better.
   

  

 We are curious, active listeners and hands-on doers.
   

  

 Beyond your work with Storelens, you will also be part of our Engineering community, where you will have access to a network of experts, resources, and opportunities to grow.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience), and at least 5-8 years of experience as a Software Engineer with mobile and front end focus.
* Proficiency in Android development in Kotlin.
* Proficiency in build secure applications with Microsoft Login and Single Sign-On capabilities.
* Experience in mobile development for multiple devices.
* Experience Integrate hardware and communicate effectively with Android applications.
* Experience to work with SDKs from external vendors.
* Experience in Consume web services (e.g., REST APIs).
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers and utilize Figma for design implementation.
* Experience of CI/ CD pipelines using Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions.
* Knowledge and apply basic Mobile Device Management (MDM) principles (e.g., Airwatch).
* Experience in POS, Payment and Checkout area is a plus.
* IOS development, experience is a plus.
* Apply basic web development skills is a plus.


*And people who have* 
 :
   

  

* Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in backend testing.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience conducting code reviews, identifying areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Familiarity in backend testing with a focus on ensuring the reliability and performance of backend systems.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Software Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss** 




 Omegapoint är ett konsultföretag som skapar framtidens digitala tjänster. Vi fortsätter att växa och letar nu efter dig som har några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
 



  





**Brinner du för säkerhet inom systemutveckling?** 




 I denna roll blir du en viktig spelare i vårt team och vi tror därför att du är en teamplayer med högt ansvarstagande och kvalitétstänk. Du trivs i kundrelationerna där du är en både strukturerad och engagerad rådgivare och har förmåga att omsätta dina kunskaper i konkreta lösningar. Du är van att agera självständigt och inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ. Som person tror vi vidare att du är öppen, positiv och trivs i en organisation präglad av kompetensutveckling där vi är vassa och snälla mot varandra.
 



 Att du vill dela med dig av din kompetens till dina kollegor genom exempelvis mentorskap eller att delta på våra interna kompetensdagar tycker vi är en självklarhet. Vi bygger och stärker vår fina kompetenskultur tillsammans!
 



  





**För den här tjänsten tror vi även att du:** 



* har minst tre års erfarenhet av programmering i Java, C#/.NET eller liknande
* arbetar kvalitetsinriktat och känner dig bekväm med såväl testdriven utveckling som automatiserade tester
* har kunskap kring IaC, pipelines och traditionell DevOps/DevSecOps
* eventuellt har erfarenhet av domändriven design
* har arbetat med agila utvecklingsmetoder
* har en akademisk examen eller motsvarande
* behärskar svenska i tal och skrift



  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala och Umeå.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig** 




 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.
 



  





 Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.
 



  





 Givetvis erbjuder vi även allt det andra som är viktigt, som marknadsmässiga löner, förstärkt föräldralön, anpassade förmånspaket, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och möjlighet till delägarskap.
 



  





 Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du kommer att trivas, utvecklas och ges alla möjligheter till en ljus framtid.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
* Hybrid – You need to be based in Stockholm or within commuting distance to come to the Stockholm office approximately three days per week.
* A valid work permit for Sweden is required.



  





 We’re looking for a
 **Backend Engineer** 
 with strong expertise in
 **Java and Python (preferably Django)** 
 to join our growing tech team. You’ll play a key role in modernizing our
 **core product** 
 , a platform that impacts
 **billions in transactions per year** 
 and supports veterinary clinics across
 **multiple countries in EMEA, US & Australia** 
 .
 



  





 This is a complex
 **system** 
 that helps clinics optimize their product recommendations, manage contracts, and track revenue. Our challenge is to scale and modernize the product, remove technical debt, and transition to
 **AWS-based infrastructure** 
 .
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* **Backend Development** 
 – Build and maintain scalable backend services in
 **Python and Java** 
 .
* **System Architecture** 
 – Contribute to system design and architecture to support growth and modernization.
* **Infrastructure & DevOps** 
 – Work with
 **Terraform, Docker, DevOps, and AWS** 
 to enhance our cloud-based infrastructure.
* **Business-Critical Development** 
 – Build features that help suppliers, clinics, and VetFamily manage
 **contracts, transactions, and product recommendations** 
 .
* **Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams** 
 – Work alongside
 **tech leads, full-stack developers, data scientists, and product owners** 
 in Sweden and France.



  





**About You** 




  





**Must-Have:** 



* Strong experience in
 **Python (Django preferred) and Java** 
 .
* Experience in
 **system architecture and software design** 
 .
* Ability to work in
 **a complex product environment** 
 .
* Strong
 **communication skills** 
 and
 **business understanding** 
 – You ask the right questions, understand revenue models, and see the big picture.



  





**Nice-to-Have:** 



* Experience with
 **Terraform, Docker, DevOps, and AWS** 
 .
* Passion for
 **animals, veterinary technology, or pet-related industries** 
 .
* Interest in working in a
 **diverse and inclusive environment** 
 .



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 🌍
 **Scale-Up Company with Global Presence** 
 – Be part of a forward-thinking company dedicated to improving veterinary care worldwide.
 



 🚀
 **Impact & Growth** 
 – Work on a high-impact product that supports veterinary clinics in multiple countries across the globe.
 



 🔧
 **Modernization & Innovation** 
 – Help transition a
 **complex system** 
 to a
 **modern AWS-based** 
 architecture.
 



 🏡
 **Hybrid Setup** 
 – Flexible work setup, with the team working together from the Stockholm office approximately three days a week.
 



 🤝
 **Global & Collaborative Team** 
 – Join a team of engineers and product specialists in Sweden and France.
 **Corporate language is English** 
 to facilitate global collaboration.
 



 If you're passionate about
 **backend engineering, system architecture, and making a real impact** 
 , we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





 🔹
 **Apply now and help us in our mission to enhance veterinary care globally!**

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
*Are you a Senior Backend Developer who thrives in a collaborative, product-focused team? With a renewed strategy and leadership team, aimed at strengthening our market position, we are growing our tech department in Stockholm. This is your chance to make a real impact by contributing to shaping our business success. We are looking for developers who want to join us on our transformation journey and are eager to embrace the shift toward product-based development.*
**Get an idea of the role**
 In the role as a Senior Backend Developer at Resurs, you’ll be part of a small end-to-end product team, collaborating closely with business stakeholders to build and enhance solutions that truly matter. The focus is on context, not just specific technologies or platforms. It is about making a real impact in a business-oriented setting and sharing the responsibility for success.
   

  

**On a personal level**
 We believe you have experience of building software for products that have reached production and maintenance stages. With a passion for solving real business challenges and delivering tangible outcomes, you bring both energy and curiosity to your work. You also have excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, with a strong interest in both the big picture and the finer details.
   

  

*On a technical level, we believe you have solid experience in:*
* Typescript/Javascript, Cloud Native
* Infrastructure-as-code, e.g. AWS CDK or Terraform
* CI/CD, e.g. Github Actions/Code Pipeline
* Serverless, e.g. Lambda/Functions, SQS/PubSub, Kinesis/Dataflow, DynamoDb/CosmosDb
* DevOps (in the sense of 'you build it, you run it', from start to finish)


 Having experience in a startup environment, with knowledge of concepts such as CQRS, DDD, TDD, SOLID, and Five Whys, as well as working in contexts influenced by regulatory requirements, would be an advantage.
   

  

**Important information**
 On final candidates, we carry out a detailed background check via an external company
   

  

**More than a job**
*Resurs is a leading bank in the Nordics with a simple philosophy: we want to create balance in people’s personal finances. On that foundation, we develop offers and services within loans, savings and payments for retail and e-commerce that are based on people’s everyday lives, and that will create long-term value for our customers. And for society. Today, we have a customer base of slightly more than 6 million customers and around 650 employees in the Nordic region.*
**Apply today!**
 Don’t wait to send in your application - selection, and interviews take place on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled before the last advertising date. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

* In this recruitment process, the supplier is solely responsible for the personal data they collect and process. Resurs is solely responsible for the personal data processed by us in the recruitment process.


 Resurs has more than 40 years of experience in retail finance and is one of the leading niche banks in the Nordics. We help companies and private individuals with lending, savings and payments. Today, we have a customer base of slightly more than 6 million customers and around 650 employees in the Nordic region.
   

  

 Follow us on Instagram:
   

  

 Resurs.Sverige
   

  

 Resurs.Norge

 Resurs.Danmark

title: Java Software Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
**Java Engineer | Stockholm | Modern Tech Consultancy** 




  





 My client, a fast growing Boutique consultancy, based in the heart of Stockholm to scale their business massively over the next year.
 



  





***What sets them apart?***




 This customer is an employee-driven-company they strive to make their business decisions around the betterment of their employees careers. This is why, very early on they decided to only pursue projects that utilise very modern tech stacks not only to capitalise on the ever-growing industry and it's innovations but also to ensure their employees are constantly working towards becoming the best Developers and versions of themselves that they can be.
 



  





**Desired Profile:** 



* Between 2-8 years of professional experience utilising a modern Java stack (typically Java 17+)
* Any experience with supporting Techs / Tools such as DevOps, Infrastructure/Networking, Cloud computing (AWS/Azure/GCP), Kubernetes or Kafka etc.
* Based in Stockholm or a commutable surrounding area.
* Fluent English & Swedish speaking.
 *Candidates with limited but progressively improving Swedish speaking capabilities will still be considered, should they be exceptional on all other fronts.*
* Any experience with leadership, mentorship or exp being a Scrum Master will be interesting and advantageous.



  





**What's on offer?:** 



* Extensive training opportunities in modern tech stacks and domains, including a monthly get-together for a day of knowledge sharing and upskilling (during working hours).
* Here you will find an environment of likeminded, passionate, peers and leaders, dedicated to the success and development of one another. Corporate workflows and environments are not prevalent. You will feel your value from Day 1.
* Paying up to 70 000 SEK / Month.
* Annual business trips.
* Consultants are deployed in teams so look forward to working with and upskilling with your colleagues whilst gaining valuable network connections on project.



  





 Sound of interest? Please apply with your up to date CV or email me at TMU@Thor-Companies.com

title: .NET developer
description:
**Who we are:** 




 Pyyne is a high-end international consultancy firm with locations in São Paulo and New York and recently opened an office in Stockholm. We lead in diversity, striving to be a gender-equal IT company that celebrates various cultures. Here, every role is tailored to our consultants, enabling you to carve your own path within the organization. Our aim is to foster your development toward your aspirations.
 



  





  





**Being a Consultant at Pyyne** 




 At Pyyne, we are a project-focused firm that empowers you to take control of your career path. We believe in your autonomy and encourage you to express your interests in projects and the technological domains you wish to explore.
 



  





 As a Consultant, you will lead your projects and work directly with clients, collaborating with their teams and stakeholders. Your insights will be crucial in developing innovative solutions tailored to their needs. Our mission extends beyond creating exceptional solutions for leading companies. At Pyyne, we are dedicated to fostering the right environment for you to reach your full potential by giving you the opportunity to take the steering wheel of your career.
 



  





  





**Must Haves:** 



* M.Sc. in Computer Science, Statistics, or a related technical/quantitative field
* 2+ years of experience in the tech industry.

**Nice to have:**

**What Pyyne offers:** 




 📊 Stock options
 



 💰Competitive salary
 



 📚 Mentorship program
 



 🌲 International environment
 



 💻 Work computer and mobile device
 



 👵 Pension allowance
 



 🤧 Health insurance
 



 🏋 Wellness allowance

title: Utvecklare till Forefront Act
description:
Ansök nu
   

  

* Sverige


 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

**Det Här Är Forefront**
 Sedan 2008 har vi vuxit till över 550 kollegor med en mångfald av erfarenheter och kompetens inom management consulting, design och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi finns på 11 kontor i Sverige och sedan årsskiftet, även i USA.
