title: Project Leader
description:
We're looking for an organized, proactive, and technically skilled Project Leader to oversee our development initiatives, coordinate website enhancements, and ensure our e-commerce projects are delivered efficiently.



**Key Responsibilities:**


* Manage the launch of new websites
* Manage website improvements, including user experience and design quality.
* Oversee the implementation of SEO strategies.
* Coordinate AI-driven content generation for product categories.
* Ensure effective personalized product recommendation systems.
* Optimize checkout processes, including shipping recommendations and targeted discount strategies.
* Implement and monitor Google Analytics and Google Ads for tracking performance.
* Recruit, onboard, and supervise a team of developers.
* Regularly track and report developer productivity.
* Facilitate review management systems to enhance customer engagement.
* Collaborate with CISO to improve systems availability and stability.
* Oversee and participate in testing processes to validate shops' proper working.
* Conduct code reviews to ensure high-quality, maintainable, scalable, unified code.
* Monitor project progress, manage risks, and resolve issues effectively. Work with the CISO to enhance the stability and availability of systems.
* Supervise and take part in testing procedures to confirm that shops are functioning correctly.
* Perform code reviews to guarantee code that is consistent, scalable, maintainable, and of high quality.
* Effectively oversee project advancement, manage risks, and find solutions to problems.



**Skills and Qualifications:**


* Proven experience in project management, ideally within e-commerce.
* Knowledge of SEO, Google Ads, Google Analytics, and website analytics.
* Familiarity with AI applications in content creation.
* Strong understanding of user experience (UX) principles and website design.
* Excellent leadership and team-management skills.
* Strong organizational and communication abilities.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks effectively in a dynamic environment.
* Create a team that quickly can launch new initiatives



**Reporting and Meetings:**


* Regular direct reporting to senior management.
* Initial twice-weekly meetings for status updates and strategic alignment.



**Benefits:**


* Join an innovative, growing e-commerce team.
* Career growth opportunities.
* Collaborative, international working environment.



**Application Process:**



Interested candidates should submit their CV and a brief cover letter highlighting relevant experience and explaining why they would be an ideal fit for this role.



We look forward to welcoming a dedicated Project Leader to drive our ongoing success.

title: Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
### **General Information**

**Locations**: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
  

Role ID
208780
Worker Type
Regular Employee
Studio/Department
EA Studios - DICE Stockholm
Flexible Work Arrangement
Hybrid
### **Description & Requirements**

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
DICE is a creative studio with offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg. We believe in the power of diversity and welcome game creators from all backgrounds to collaborate with us as we unlock the potential for the future of Battlefield!


We're always pushing to be at the forefront of creative entertainment - blending digital art, design, and technology to push boundaries. Our collaborative culture is fueled by passion, driving innovation and making a positive difference for our players and community.


At DICE, your ideas matter. We offer an inclusive space where you can thrive, be yourself, and grow alongside a team dedicated to making a meaningful impact to the world of gaming.


We're all-in on the future and our most ambitious Battlefield yet. Want to be part of something special? Read on.


**The Role**


We believe that to provide the best possible experience for our players we need the best tools possible!


As a *Fullstack Engineer* at Foundational Tech(FT) Online, you will design, implement and maintain internal web-based tools that will be used by our Live team to engage with millions of our players across the globe, dynamically changing the gameplay experience, progression, in-game store, matchmaking and many other aspects of our games. You will report into a *Development Director*.


FT Online works in small teams that collaborate to create online solutions for our games, using modern technologies and frameworks deployed to a cloud-based infrastructure. You will integrate with multiple existing systems; some developed in-house and some by external parties. You will work with many different teams within EA.


**Responsibilities**


* Collaborate with stakeholders (e.g. game design, UX, product and analytics teams) to identify and fulfill online game design needs
* Analyze, design, specify and implement game design features/solutions
* Work in an agile engineering team - writing well designed, testable, maintainable and scalable code
* Be part of technical architecture discussions and help guide technical decisions within the team
* Drive continuous improvement of software quality, customer experience, and maintainability of products/features


**Requirements**


* 5+ years of experience in TypeScript, including an understanding of concepts like closures, asynchronous programming, state management and dependency injection patterns
* 5+ years of experience working on web projects applying modern web development best practices, from UI in the front-end to micro-services and cloud services in the back end
* Experience with continuous integration and delivery
* Experience developing distributed, resilient, and scalable back-end systems using Scala, Java, or other JVM language
* Write clear / concise maintainable, testable (unit & integration testing) code


**Nice to have:**


* Experience with React and Mobx.
* Experience with Kubernetes or other container-orchestration systems.
* Experience with cloud services.
* Experience with functional languages (e.g. Scala)
* Contributions to Open-Source projects.

  

  

  

***About Electronic Arts***
We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.  

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.  

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Head of Product Design
description:
**Company Description**  

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced individual to join the Visa Open Banking Solutions team as the Head of Product Design.


The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in creating best-in-class user interfaces and experiences, ensuring that users enjoy a seamless and engaging journey throughout the entire product flow. This role demands a keen eye for detail, creativity, and a deep understanding of user-centered design principles to consistently deliver exceptional and intuitive user experiences.


The Head of Product Design will be part of the tech and product organization, responsible for the overall design direction and delivery of a complex portfolio of products. In terms of impact, this person will have a key role in shaping the design direction and vision across a large organization, while also improving design efficiency and outcome. The role will have manager responsibility for a team of highly skilled multi-disciplinary designers (3-5 direct reports), and it will also directly contribute to key design projects, for example the ongoing management and upgrade of the design system used by the teams.


Key Responsibilities:

* Communicate and motivate design strategy and decisions throughout Visa Open Banking while offering design direction to teams and stakeholders
* Establish yourself as a key strategic partner in the product and tech organization, effectively manage a wide variety of stakeholders, being the voice of design in the extended leadership team
* Establish design principles and standards for high quality deliveries
* Lead a team of multi-disciplinary designers to support their career, skill progression and growth
* Support and mentor your team in the delivery of design projects to ensure high quality and successful outcomes
* Lead and deliver key design projects yourself, actively contributing to the team’s design output and making sure that you lead by example in the team
* Lead the creation and rollout of a unified design system
* Identify high-impact initiatives that will enable our product teams to deliver an exceptional experience to their end users
* Continuously improve ways of working with design across the organization
* Collaborate and drive integration efforts between Visa Open Banking and the larger Visa design organization


This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

 **Qualifications**  

Basic Qualifications

* 10 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 8 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters/ MBA/JD/MD) or at least 3 years of work experience with a PhD


Preferred Qualifications

* 12 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6+ years of work experience with a PhD
* Excellent UX and UI design skills, demonstrated by a strong portfolio
* 5+ years of design leadership experience in a digital product organization
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a large organization
* Strong leadership skills, with the ability to find a way forward even when things are uncertain and motivate the team
* Experience with user research and usability testing
* Experience with design in Figma
* Experience with managing and maintaining a design system
* Preferably experience in the payments and financial industry

  

**Additional Information**  

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: UX Lead to Gothenburg
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of sustainable transport? A pioneering company in the logistics industry is looking for a UX Lead to drive digital transformation in a sector ripe for change. With a start-up mentality and a mission to accelerate the journey toward Net Zero Emission Transport, this organization offers an exciting opportunity to lead impactful user experience design.
  
This full-time, on-site assignment is based in Gothenburg and runs from April 21st 2025 to March 31st 2026, with possible extension.
  
About the RoleIn this role, you’ll be leading the UX strategy and execution for a cutting-edge digital platform within the logistics sector. Reporting directly to product and business leadership, you’ll guide design processes from research through to implementation. Your work will play a key part in defining how the transport industry embraces digitalization and sustainability, while collaborating across agile teams to ensure a user-centered approach throughout.
  
Responsibilities Define and own the overall UX strategy and design direction for the digital product
  
Collaborate with product owners, developers, and business stakeholders to align UX goals with business objectives and technical constraints
  
Conduct user research through interviews, usability tests, and competitor analysis
  
Translate insights into actionable design improvements that enhance the product experience
  
Advocate for user needs across the organization and articulate design decisions clearly
  
Develop and maintain design systems and workflows that support scalability
  
Lead and mentor team members on UX best practices and methods
  
About You
  
You’re a seasoned UX professional with a passion for solving real-world challenges through user-centered design. Your background in logistics gives you a strong grasp of the domain's complexities, and you thrive in dynamic, agile environments where collaboration and innovation drive the work forward. You’re not just comfortable with change—you welcome it, question the status quo, and deliver meaningful, user-driven results.
  
Experience and Skills Minimum 5 years of experience in UX design, with proven leadership in user-centered product development
  
Strong knowledge of UX research methodologies and usability testing practices
  
Previous experience in the logistics or transport industry, especially with the transport buyer perspective
  
Skilled in tools such as Figma, Sketch, or similar design platforms
  
Strong presentation and stakeholder management skills
  
Experience working in agile and cross-functional teams
  
Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
  
Swedish language skills are a plus
  
About the assignment
  
For this assignment you will be hired as a full-time consultant by Digitalenta. We offer our consultants a generous package including healthcare allowance, insurance policy, paid vacation days and pension savings. In addition, you'll also have a dedicated consultant manager available throughout your employment with us, in addition to optional networking activities with our network of consultants.

title: Senior 3D Generalist (fixed term: ASAP to 2026-01-31)
description:
**Are you experienced in CG work for configurators, animations and images? Join our fast-moving CGI studio in Gothenburg and get an opportunity to work on a variety of projects in automotive, UX, and more.**

  

Team Brickland wishes to invite a talented 3D generalist artist to join us full-time. As a 3D Generalist, you should be able to achieve a high level of quality in production with skills in modeling, texturing, shading, lighting, and compositing. We appreciate if you have gained extended knowledge from similar industries to ours and are familiar with different kinds of productions. The number of years you have spent doing 3D artistic work is not that important to us. We know that talent and a will to learn will take you further.


It’s preferred that you know Cinema4D or feel comfortable committing to learning it. We regard a strong artistic eye and curiosity higher so don’t let the software stand in your way. While not a requirement to have real-time or game engine (Unity/Unreal) experience, you should have a keen interest in real-time, and an ambition to learn more.


We have a key role to fill, as we are now on the lookout to find the right candidate. The position is located in our studio in Gothenburg. It is important that you are able to relocate. We offer a flexible workplace and part-time remote work is up for discussion.

**Key roles and responsibilities:**

  

* Comfortably deliver and prepare scenes for stills and animation, both in collaboration and on your own.
* Scene construction (studio, interiors, exteriors, landscapes, and environments).
* Lighting.
* Handling textures and shaders, sometimes the whole chain from scanning to ready-to-use textures.
* Model prep and basic modeling.
* Rendering and compositing.
* Troubleshoot to implement solutions with Supervisors. Provide insights, implement and come up with ideas together with the team whilst keeping your head cool and delivering on time.
* Make sure your work tasks run as planned, foresee issues, and solve these together with the project managers.
* Keep up on current technology trends and tools, both hardware and software.

 **Preferable experience and skills:**

* 3 + years of experience as a CG Artist/3D Artist or similar.
* An understanding of 3D production pipelines and the ability to work with computer-generated images; knowledge and use of render passes, 3D principles and techniques
* Experience in After Effects, Nuke and/or other compositing software.
* Hands-on 3D skills. Brickland's main 3D software is Cinema 4D.
* The ability to multitask and prioritize your work on a long-term basis as well as on a day-to-day level.
* Maintain strong file structure discipline with clearly named layers and folders following our standard structure.
* Utilize a non-destructive workflow and automated processes to quickly set up files.
* Ability to diagnose limitations of the projects and help plan alternatives.
* A strong desire for continuous learning.
* An excellent artistic eye.

  

**Benefits**


* Annual holiday allowance - 25 days excluding bank holidays.
* Flexible working hours.
* Remote work up to two days per week.
* Education (workshops, courses).
* Swedish health care (friskvård).
* Social Events (lunches, office events, trips and after works).

**ABOUT THE POSITION**

* Fixed term from as soon as possible to the end of January 2026, with possibility of extension.
* The salary is negotiated with the candidate


For further information regarding the position contact our People Manager


Sofia Hamilton Sofia@brickland.se


**We are looking forward to hearing from you!**


**ABOUT US**


Brickland is a creative studio based in Gothenburg. We are a diverse group of designers, technologists and artists, driven by a shared passion for CGI, motion and VFX. We collaborate with global clients across industries to create visual experiences that captivate a large audience. Our vision is to shape tomorrow's digital landscape with immersive visual narratives.


We enjoy the process as much as the finish, and we believe that the whole event should be rewarding for everybody involved. In simple terms, we love to create together with our fellow artists and with our clients.


We have a key role to fill, as we are now on the lookout to find the right candidate. The position is located in our studio in Gothenburg. It is important that you are able to commute to the office or that you can relocate here. We offer a flexible workplace and part-time remote work is up for discussion.

title: 3D Lead (substitute for parental leave)
description:
**Are you experienced in CG work for configurators, animations and images? Join our fast-moving CGI studio in Gothenburg and get an opportunity to work on a variety of projects in automotive, UX, and more.**

  

Team Brickland wishes to invite a talented 3D Lead assubstitute for parental leave (with possibility of extension) .


 At Brickland, your position as a **3D Lead** is vital. You not only guide our 3D team with dedication but also ensure our projects shine with quality and align with our artistic aspirations – while staying true to deadlines. Your blend of 3D artistry, pipeline expertise, and leadership not only oversees but also enriches our content development.


As a 3D lead at Brickland, you’ll conceive and develop ideas that solve important client problems and make their dream come alive. By thinking beyond briefs and proposing ideas clients may not expect, you’ll help build Brickland’s reputation for work that is ground-breaking and influential.


**ABOUT US**


Brickland is a creative studio based in Gothenburg. We are a diverse group of designers, technologists and artists, driven by a shared passion for CGI, motion and VFX. We collaborate with global clients across industries to create visual experiences that captivate a large audience. Our vision is to shape tomorrow's digital landscape with immersive visual narratives.


We enjoy the process as much as the finish, and we believe that the whole event should be rewarding for everybody involved. In simple terms, we love to create together with our fellow artists and with our clients.


We have a key role to fill, as we are now on the lookout to find the right candidate. The position is located in our studio in Gothenburg. It is important that you are able to commute to the office or that you can relocate here. We offer a flexible workplace and part-time remote work is up for discussion.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Lead the 3D team providing guidance, mentorship, and feedback to ensure high-quality output and professional growth.
* Collaborate with the Creative Director or Art Director and producers, project leads/managers to understand and implement the project's artistic vision.
* Oversee the creation and delivery of 3D content, including models, animations, and visual effects.
* Develop and enforce best practices and workflows for 3D production.
* Contribute to the recruitment, training, and development of 3D artists within the team. This includes giving feedback and plan for individual development and contribute to Eternal Onboarding activities.
* Maintain a hands-on approach by contributing to scene creation, modelling, texturing, rigging, and animation tasks as needed.
* Stay updated with the latest trends, tools, and technologies in 3D design and animation.
* Coordinate with other departments to ensure alignment and integration of work processes.
* Manage timelines, deliverables, and resources effectively, ensuring projects are delivered on time.
* Facilitate communication and collaboration within the team and with external stakeholders.

**Ideal Candidate Profile:**


* Minimum of 4 years experience in 3D or animation, with a proven track record in a leadership role.
* Strong portfolio showcasing high-quality 3D art and an understanding of artistic fundamentals.
* Expertise in 3D software such as Cinema4D, Blender, Houdini or similar. Along with compositing tools such as After Effects, Photoshop, Resolve or similar.
* Knowledge of the entire 3D production pipeline, including modeling, texturing, rigging, animation, rendering, and Compositing.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and team management skills.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Creative thinking with the ability to push boundaries and innovate.

**BENEFITS**


* Annual Holiday Allowance - 25 days plus Swedish Bank Holidays.
* Remote work can be discussed (We work hybrid)
* Health care allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Flexible Working Hours (9-15 are for teamwork)
* Social Events - We have a fantastic company culture, we like to go out for lunch, have some fun competitions in the office, go away on trips and there might be a beer or two on a Friday.
  

**ABOUT THE POSITION**

* Substitute for parental leave (Fixed term from as soon as possible to the end of January 2026, with possibility of extension)
* The salary is negotiated with the candidate


For further information regarding the position contact our People Manager


Sofia Hamilton Sofia@brickland.se


**We are looking forward to hearing from you!**

title: Enhetschefer inom systemutveckling, Norrköping
description:
På Migrationsverket arbetar vi med en av vår tids stora samhällsfrågor – migrationen. Totalt är vi cirka 6 000 personer här, och vi har ett ovanligt viktigt jobb!

*Migratio**nsverket finns för människor som söker skydd i Sverige och för dem som vill arbeta, studera eller bo här. Detta gör vi inom asylrättens och den reglerade invandringens gränser. Vi tar emot ansökningar, prövar dem och fattar beslut om vilka som har rätt att komma hit eller stanna här, och vilka som måste lämna landet. I vårt arbete vägleds vi av våra värdeord mod, empati och tydlighet. Myndigheten är inne i ett digitaliseringsarbete som innebär en förändring av processer och arbetssätt inom hela myndigheten med fokus på innovativa digitala lösningar, automatisering och livscykelhantering, och agila arbetssätt.*

Nu söker vi enhetschefer till enheterna för plattformsutveckling och inom applikationsutveckling.


Inom Digitalisering och utvecklingsavdelningen finns idag åtta enheter inom systemutveckling, 5st på sektionen för tjänsteutveckling där det dessutom finns två enheter med fokus på processutveckling inom våra kärnprocesser tillstånd, asyl och service. Där finns även en enhet som arbetar med övergripande designfrågor och agerar bryggan mellan IT och verksamhet. På sektionen för Drift och teknikutveckling bedrivs plattformsutveckling på tre stycken enheter som också innehar kompetenser inom systemutveckling.


Välkommen till en avdelning med högt ställda ambitioner i en myndighet som driver ett kontinuerligt förändringsarbete och som präglas av nytänkande, handlingskraft och ett genuint engagemang för vår uppgift!


Läs gärna mer om vår it-avdelning här.

**Ditt uppdrag**  

Som enhetschef ansvarar du för att styra och leda en enhet med huvudfokus på systemutveckling. Enheten kommer bestå av ett 15-tal medarbetare och ett antal konsulter. Enheten omfattar idag alla kompetenser för att bedriva it-utveckling och jobbar även nära kompetenser med verksamhetskunskap. Exempel på kompetenser inom enheten idag är systemutvecklare, kravanalytiker, UX-design, produktansvarig och mjukvaruarkitekt.


Vi jobbar med att utveckla våra arbetssätt bla. genom att jobba mer tvärfunktionellt och att föra samman verksamhet och IT ytterligare. Din roll är att tillsammans med sektionsledningen säkerställa en långsiktig strategi och leda enheten mot uppställda mål. Hela avdelningen står inför en kraftig expansion där rekrytering och onboarding av nya medarbetare är en viktig arbetsuppgift.


Du har personal- budget- och arbetsmiljöansvar för din enhet och ingår i sektionens ledningsgrupp, där du förväntas ta ett helhetsperspektiv och ha ett nära samarbete med dina chefskollegor för att vi ska nå våra gemensamma mål. De flesta av sektionens personal inom systemutveckling är stationerad i Norrköping


Inom sektionen för plattformsutveckling efterfrågas en enhetschef med placering i Norrköping. Ansvarsområden för ny enhet kommer vara AI och gemensamma plattformar för nytt handläggningsstöd.

**Vem är du?**

Som ledare har du ett helhetsperspektiv och agerar med personlig mognad i samspelet med medarbetare, chefskollegor, styrgrupper och användare. Du är handlingskraftig och systematisk med förmåga att organisera, genomföra och följa upp för att leverera mot uppsatta mål. Du har ett genuint engagemang för att följa teknisk utveckling och skeenden i omvärlden, med förståelse för vad det ger för möjligheter för att bedriva modern och effektiv utveckling och förvaltning. Du behöver vara trygg i ditt ledarskap med förmåga att skapa förutsättningar för dina medarbetare att växa i sina roller och att skapa ett klimat som inspirerar till arbetsglädje och effektivitet. Du är en god kommunikatör, lyhörd och prestigelös. Det är viktigt att du är synlig och tillgänglig för medarbetarna och utövar ett tillitsbaserat ledarskap.


I vårt arbete som statstjänstemän ställs även höga krav på omdöme och en hög säkerhets -och sekretessmedvetenhet. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.

**Du som söker har**

* akademisk examen inom it/datavetenskap eller annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant för befattningen
* flerårig erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla medarbetare och verksamhet inom it-området i kombination med erfarenhet av arbete med systemutveckling.
* erfarenhet av att planera och resurssätta med hänsyn till uppdragens beskaffenhet, tillgänglig kompetens och ekonomiska medel.
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* flerårig erfarenhet av agila metoder.

**Det är meriterande om du har**

* gedigen erfarenhet inom systemutveckling.
* erfarenhet av att arbeta i en större organisation.
* erfarenhet av produktägarskap inom it-området.
* flerårig chefserfarenhet inom it-området.

**Upplysningar**  

Anställningsform: heltid, tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders provanställning  

Placeringsort: Norrköping  

Arbetstid: förtroendearbetstid
  

Tillträde: snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.

*Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kommer att genomföras. Utifrån detta ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap. Anställningen förutsätter en godkänd säkerhetsprövning.*

**Vill du veta mer**  

Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande sektionschef Stefan Andersson eller sektionschef Anna Surén på, tel 010-485 71 53 eller enhetschef Marlene Öhlund på på 010-203 43 00.

**Ansökan**


Välkommen med dina ansökningshandlingar senast den 20 april 2025!  

Vi tar emot din ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem.


\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Om rekryteringsprocessen För oss är det viktigt att all kompetens på arbetsmarknaden tillvaratas. Vi välkomnar därför alla sökande och strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och mångfald. Som statlig myndighet rekryterar vi efter förtjänst och skicklighet. På arbetsgivarverket.se kan du läsa mer om vad det innebär. Vi använder urvalsfrågor under ansökningen. Besvara dem så utförligt du kan eftersom dina svar har betydelse för om du är kvalificerad att gå vidare i rekryteringen eller inte. I vissa rekryteringar använder vi också tester för att bedöma hur väl din skicklighet stämmer överens med tjänsten du söker. Vid en eventuell intervju kan du även få svara på frågor kopplat till säkerhet. Vill du komma i kontakt med fackliga företrädare finns kontaktuppgifter till Saco-S, Seko och ST längst ned på sidan ”Lediga jobb och intresseanmälan” på migrationsverket.se: Alla lediga jobb på Migrationsverket just nu - Migrationsverket För att arbeta på Migrationsverket behöver du ha rätt att vistas och arbeta i Sverige på någon av dessa grunder: svenskt medborgarskap (krav för vissa tjänster), nordiskt medborgarskap, EU-medborgarskap eller permanent uppehållstillstånd. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter, eller annan information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd, ska du kontakta rekrytering@migrationsverket.se innan du gör din ansökan så berättar vi mer om våra säkerhetsrutiner. Här kan du läsa mer om hur Migrationsverket hanterar personuppgifter Migrationsverkets rekryteringar sker helt i vår egen eller upphandlade leverantörers regi. Vi ber därför om att inte få telefonsamtal och mejl från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 4 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Norrköping | Län: Östergötlands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 3.3.1-2025- 4077 | Kontakt: Anna Surén 010-4858696, Marlene Öhlund 010-2034300, Stefan Andersson 010-4857153, | Publicerat: 2025-03-27 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-20

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Resolution Games is a visual computing studio with a proven track record creating immersive gaming experiences for all. We believe that VR and AR aren’t just an add-on for gaming; they are the next logical steps for games.
 



  





 Are you a UX/UI Designer with a love for collaboration? Do you enjoy shaping intuitive, player-first experiences across a variety of platforms and game styles? Then you might be the person we’re looking for.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We're looking for a versatile UX/UI Designer to join our Shared Resources team and help craft seamless, engaging interfaces across multiple game projects. You’ll take part in everything from UX flows and interaction design to final UI visuals and in-game implementation, working closely with game teams to deliver experiences that feel effortless and immersive on both VR and flatscreen platforms.
 



  





 As part of Shared Resources, a cross-disciplinary team that supports multiple titles in parallel, you’ll work in sprints shifting between game teams. This means, you’ll need to be comfortable switching focus between projects over time. Your ability to bring clarity to complexity, maintain design consistency, and adapt to different visual styles and gameplay needs will make a real impact across the studio.
 



  





 This is not a role for someone who wants to redesign everything from scratch every time. Instead, we’re looking for a designer who can step into existing systems, respect established visual and ux directions, and build on them with thoughtful additions. You’ll collaborate with people from different disciplines and should feel comfortable shaping solutions even when they’re based on input or ideas that differ from your own.
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 



* Design user flows, wireframes, and mockups using Figma
* Design for VR, PC, and mobile with a focus on clarity and comfort
* Support implementation of UI assets in Unity, or collaborate closely with those who do
* Maintain and contribute to shared design systems and libraries
* Work across a variety of projects, genres, and visual styles
* Test, evaluate, and refine designs based on team and player feedback
* Collaborate with developers, artists, designers, and producers throughout the dev cycle
* Create high-quality UI mockups and final art assets



  





**Requirements:** 



* At least three years of experience in UX design and UI art in the games industry
* Proficient in Figma and Adobe suite
* Strong visual skills in layout, typography, and hierarchy
* Experience working with design systems and UX documentation
* Excellent written and spoken English



  





**Nice to haves:** 



* Familiarity with Unity
* Digital painting or illustration skills
* Experience working with concept art and adapting to varied art direction
* Background in VR/AR interface design



  





 We’re especially looking for someone who is collaborative, curious, and adaptable. You know how to design with others - not just for them. You value structure but aren’t afraid of a bit of organized chaos. You can keep the big picture in mind while sweating the small stuff. You’re comfortable context-switching across projects without losing sight of what good UX and UI looks and feels like.
 



  





*This role does require professional experience, but don’t let a few missing bullet points hold you back. Studies show that women and other underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. If you have a solid foundation and feel excited about the opportunity, we’d love to hear from you.* 




  





**Who we are** 




 Resolution Games is a visual computing studio with a proven track record creating immersive gaming experiences for all. We believe that VR and AR aren’t just an add-on for gaming; they are the next logical steps for games. As players and game developers alike, we’ve always dreamed of this day - the day when we can be IN the games we love. That day is finally here, and we are putting all of our energy into making the most of it for all, whether it’s creating a positive experience for someone testing out VR for the first time to delivering a rich, in-depth multiplayer game that keeps enthusiasts hungry for more.
 



  





 We are looking for someone who wants a unique opportunity and enjoys collaborating. Someone who wants to be a part of a team raising the bar and creating a new set of standards. Our colleagues have can-do attitudes who appreciate a small studio culture. Therefore, even though we have grown, we continue to work in small teams and experiment while tackling complex challenges. We value having every voice heard and seek out diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do. Last but not least, we want those of you who are not just skilled but also a great addition to the team. That is because we believe in team over the individual, a great mix of freedom with responsibility, and that people should always come before the process.

title: Social Media Content Creator Specialist
company_industry: Manufacturing, Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage, and Retail
description:
No Relocation Assistance Offered
   

  

 Job Number #166106 - Stockholm, Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Colgate-Palmolive Company is a global consumer products company operating in over 200 countries specializing in Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care, Skin Care, and Pet Nutrition. Our products are trusted in more households than any other brand in the world, making us a household name!
   

  

 Join Colgate-Palmolive, a caring, innovative growth company reimagining a healthier future for people, their pets, and our planet. Guided by our core values—Caring, Inclusive, and Courageous—we foster a culture that inspires our people to achieve common goals. Together, let's build a brighter, healthier future for all.
   

  

**Reporting to : Northern Europe Digital Engagement Lead
   

  

 Based in: Danderyd, SE**
**Why Work For Colgate Palmolive:**
* The learning & development opportunities: You will refine your commercial mindset and continue to learn new skills working closely with a cross-functional team giving you exposure to all local market departments.
* The challenge & variety: You will operate in a fast paced operational environment, directly impacting the day-to-day performance of the business, with personal accountability for your business.
* The global experience: You will have the opportunity to work with global brands, participate in global strategies with potential to develop your career internationally.
* The Colgate Values: We are Caring, We are Inclusive and We are Courageous are integral to how we operate every day.


**Job Purpose**
 Working within a fast-paced digital content marketing role, you will be responsible for the planning & creation of all social media content across Tik Tok & Instagram, across two brands and three markets: Denmark, Sweden & Norway. We are looking for an ambitious, kind and proactive in-house social content creator & manager to join our expanding Social Team. You’ll plan and develop trend & people first social content ensuring the content style ladders to our brands’ creative and tonal strategy. You must live and breathe social, ensuring you keep up to date with the latest algorithm and feature updates, whilst constantly remaining on top of relevant social trends.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Creation of organic posts a for Colgate (three markets) & Sanex (one market) partially following content plans provided by the that UK provide across Instagram and Tik Tok
* Creation of detailed monthly content plans with sign off from local market digital lead informed by business priorities
* Accelerate content creator led content across the hub, beyond organic social (i.e. paid media campaigns)
* Successful onboard of new influencer agency for 2025
* Attendance of PR events that require social media content to be created
* Localised 2025 social strategies to be created and presented across Norway, Denmark & Sweden
* Monthly social upskilling to CD & CE teams across Norway, Denmark & Sweden
* Boosting of organic posts to relevant audiences in order to amplify our message
* Ongoing reporting & measurement in order to grow our reach & engagement rate
* Stakeholder management ensuring plans & results are shared on time and in full


**Who You Are**
* Min 2 years experience in creating content ( particularly short form videos on Instagram)
* Min 2 years experience in creating content plans aligned to business objectives, target audiences & social trends
* Experience working in fast-paced environments juggling the management of different social accounts
* Experience of proactive community management
* Experience working across different markets (Nordics is desirable)
* Managing content creators end to end is desirable
* Boosting organic posts through Tik Tok business manager and Facebook business management is desirable
* Proficiency in local languages of Norwegian, Danish & Swedish is desirable


**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 Achieving our purpose starts with our people — ensuring our workforce represents the people and communities we serve —and creating an environment where our people feel they belong; where we can be our authentic selves, feel treated with respect and have the support of leadership to impact the business in a meaningful way.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please complete this request form should you require accommodation.

title: Product Designer
description:
***Product Designer***




  





 Applications are considered on a rolling basis
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm +1 more
 



  





**Ready to shape the future of HR tech in the Nordics** 




 At Simployer, we may not be disrupting space-time with quantum breakthroughs—but we're on a bold mission of our own: becoming the preferred HR-tech partner in Northern Europe. With 300 passionate Simployees and over 600 MNOK in ARR, we're already a major player in the Nordic SaaS landscape—and we're just getting started.
 



  





 Now, we’re looking for our next creative powerhouse: a Product Designer to join our growing product department, which includes 24 brilliant minds—7 of them designers—dedicated to building exceptional, human-centric experiences.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 This is a hands-on, end-to-end design role. One day you’ll be exploring big-picture ideas on a whiteboard; the next, you’re knee-deep in Figma refining every detail for developer handoff.
 



 You’re adaptable in your approach, knowing when to streamline and move fast, and when to dig deeper to ensure quality and impact. As a Product Designer at Simployer, you’ll work closely with Product Managers and Engineers to solve meaningful problems. You'll lead initiatives, shape customer journeys, and design beautiful, intuitive UIs that bring real value to thousands of users. We're also counting on you to help shape how we work as a design team—because we’re building more than products; we’re building a strong design culture.
 



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**What You’ll Bring** 




 • 3+ years of experience designing digital products
 



 • Experience working across the entire product design process—from discovery to delivery
 



 • Strong visual, interaction, and user experience design skills
 



 • Proficiency in Figma (and other tools you love)
 



 • Experience of working with design systems
 



 • Understanding of user testing and product analytics
 



 • Tech-savviness—a plus if you’re familiar with front-end development
 



 • Commercial mindset—you get how design supports business goals
 



 • Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
 



 • A collaborative, curious mindset and a portfolio that shows off your thinking, craft, and impact
 



  





**What We Offer** 




 At Simployer, our people are everything. We foster an inclusive, purpose-driven culture where you can do your best work—and be yourself while doing it. Here’s what you can expect:
 



  





 • A hybrid, flexible work setup with offices located in central Stockholm and Oslo
 



 • A strong sense of belonging—our culture is built on trust, openness, and mutual respect
 



 • Opportunities to grow—professionally and personally
 



 • Talented design and product colleagues who’ll challenge, support, and inspire you
 



 • A company that values well-being, balance, and recognition
 



  





**Message from the hiring manager** 




 "Hi! My name is Niclas and I’ll be your new manager. I have a long history of working with both design, product development and HR now leading the Design team at Simployer. I love being in a product company with such high ambitions having the opportunity to build a dream team to create great user experiences for our customers. I look forward to receiving your application. Don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have questions regarding the position!"
 



  





 Let’s build the future of HR—together
 



  





 Apply today and become part of a Nordic success story that puts people first!
 



  





 We review applications on an ongoing basis—so don’t wait to get in touch.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Simployer is a people- and performance-driven company — we believe both are essential to creating lasting value and long-term success. With a unique blend of people-centric technology, expert services, and HR know-how, we support over 15,000 customers and 1.2 million users across Northern Europe. For decades, we’ve helped businesses unleash the full potential in people — the core asset of any company. Our solutions are trusted by leaders who want to simplify the complex, build strong cultures, and empower their teams to grow in meaningful and sustainable ways. We believe in a growth mindset — that curiosity, learning, and adaptability are key to both personal development and business results. At Simployer, you’ll be part of a culture where people take ownership, have real impact, and grow with the company. While we’re serious about what we do, we also believe that work should be enjoyable. We have fun, we support each other, and we celebrate wins together.
 



  





 We’re on an exciting journey, with bold ambitions to continue growing our company and expanding into new markets across Northern Europe. As we grow, we’re looking for people who share our belief: when people grow, businesses thrive.
 



  





**Contact Person** 




 Niclas Giertz
 



 niclas.giertz@simployer.com
 



 +460733113194

title: Social Media & UGC Specialist
description:
**Join us in building world-class creativity apps used by millions.** 




 Appostrophe is a Stockholm-based mobile app studio making tools that help people create standout content for social media.
 



  





 We’re hiring a Social Media & UGC Specialist for our flagship app SCRL, a purpose-built design app loved by millions of creatives.
 



  





  





**Role overview** 




 This role is for someone who’s deeply connected to creator culture, knows social media inside out, and is driven to make an impact. You’re ambitious, with a clear focus on helping SCRL grow faster and reach more creators through smart, community-led work.
 



  





 You’ll be part of our in-house creative team, sourcing content from our audience for high-performing ads, growing the community, and sparking word of mouth about SCRL.
 



  





  





**What you’ll do** 



* Build an engaged community around SCRL by making our social channels a source of inspiration and encouraging creators to share their work using the app.
* Lead UGC sourcing from start to finish, including outreach, coordination, contracts, and content delivery for use in ads and other channels.
* Stay on top of trends, user feedback, and creator conversations to keep content fresh and relevant.



  





  





**We’re looking for** 



* A genuine interest in visual storytelling, photography, or design, with a strong sense of what resonates in creative communities.
* Hands-on experience creating social media content for platforms like Instagram and TikTok, with a good eye for what makes content engaging and shareable.
* Familiarity with video editing tools like CapCut or Adobe Premiere Pro, or a willingness to learn.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken, with the ability to adapt tone for different formats and audiences.
* A creative and curious mindset. You stay ahead of trends, love experimenting, and bring ideas grounded in insight.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. You are comfortable managing multiple timelines, creators, and content pieces at once.



  





  





**Bonus points if you…** 



* Have a background in digital media, motion design, or visual communication.



  





  





**Why join us** 



* Make a real impact. Your work will reach millions of users.
* Enjoy a startup environment with fast decisions, real ownership, and close collaboration across the team.
* Work with a supportive, experienced marketing team that values creativity, collaboration, and great execution.
* Be part of a profitable startup with a long-term vision.
* Enjoy a great office and team culture in central Stockholm.
* Receive a competitive salary and benefits package.

title: Fazer Business Graduate Program
description:
**Grow with us. Join us in**
**Fazer Business Graduate Program**
**Are you ready to kick-start your career and become a future business leader, driving the next chapter of Fazer’s success?**
 Fazer Business Graduate Program offers you a unique growth path by giving you the possibility to learn and challenge yourself. You will grow as a professional and gain valuable experience and memorable moments while expanding your professional network in one of the most iconic consumer brands in the Nordics. We are looking for newly graduated or soon to graduate team players with a higher academic degree to take this first step towards a career at Fazer.
   

  

**Program structure**
* Permanent position with all Fazer employee benefits
* 24-month programme, including three 8-month rotations through key business areas: marketing, sales and finance
* One rotation abroad (outside your home country) to gain international exposure
* Personal mentor, buddy support and tailored coaching throughout the program


**Why choose Fazer?**
 As a business graduate at Fazer, you will take on challenging roles across different teams and business units. Independent projects and real responsibilities provide an excellent foundation for growth and a fast track to becoming top talent in business. You will be surrounded by experienced, committed and inspiring colleagues, and build a strong professional network through collaboration with other graduates, colleagues and partners across functions.
   

  

 You will contribute to building our iconic brands and developing innovative, sustainable food solutions that create meaningful moments in everyday life. At Fazer, everyone can make an impact – we are a forward-looking, creative industry leader. You will be part of an inclusive and collaborative culture that values authenticity and empowers people to reach their full potential. We grow, learn and succeed together.
   

  

 Learn more what our colleagues are saying about working at Fazer!
   

  

**What will you bring to the team?**
 You are a development-minded team player with solid analytical competence. You have good collaboration and interpersonal skills combined with competence and mindset to develop business and yourself. You act proactively with high ambition to grow as a professional in business, even though you know it sometimes takes stamina and resilience to get there. You are willing and able to regularly rotate between roles, teams, and locations. Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English are a must. You have completed or will soon complete your first higher academic degree in a relevant field (e.g. business, sales, marketing or economics) with no more than two years since graduation.
   

  

**Apply now to create moments that matter.**
 Please fill in the application form, attach your CV and a short video
 **by April 27** 
**th** 
**.** 
  

  

 Please note that in addition to this opportunity in Sweden, a parallel graduate recruitment process is currently ongoing in Finland. You may choose to apply to the location that best suits your preferences and mobility.
   

  

 The selection process will include assessments, interviews and assignments during May. The program will start in early September 2025.
   

  

 In questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact our recruitment team at [email protected].
   

  

*Fazer, The Food Experience Company, enables people to enjoy the best moments of their day. Our mission, Food with a purpose, builds on our strong more than 130-year heritage, consumer first approach and innovations to create the sustainable food solutions of the future. With our dedicated team of approximately 5,000 professionals, we focus on fast-moving consumer goods and our direct-to-consumer business in Northern Europe, and beyond with exports to more than 40 countries. Fazer’s operations comply with its Code of Conduct that is based on the Group’s values and the UN Global Compact. In 2024, Fazer Group had net sales of 1,200 million euros.*
*Northern Magic. Made Real.*

title: Communicator with Change Management experience needed!
company_industry: Staffing and Recruiting and Motor Vehicle Manufacturing
description:
*Are you passionate about making complex changes feel clear and engaging? We’re looking for a skilled Communicator to join our client’s Transition Program and play a key role in driving impactful communication across teams and channels. In this dynamic position, you’ll help shape how change is communicated and experienced by both managers and employees—making a real difference in a fast-paced, collabo rative environment.* 




  





**About the position** 




 We are looking for a Communicator for our client. The company is a world-leading supplier of transport solutions and is driving the transition to a sustainable transport system. This position is located at the client’s office in Södertälje.
 



  





 The client is undergoing a transformative transition to strengthen innovation and maintain its leading position in the global transportation market. As part of this, most of the company’s Research and Development (R&D) operations will integrate into their sister brands internationally to foster collaboration and innovation. To facilitate this complex transition, they are seeking an experienced Communicator with Change Management experience. You will support the Program Manager and Program Team and ensure timely execution of program goals, including related Communication and Change Management activities.
 



  





**Your daily tasks** 




 The Communicator will support the Program Manager and be part of the Transition Program as a core team member. This role is pivotal for planning, driving, and executing communication activities across several channels and events for managers and employees. Your key responsibilities include a variety of tasks, including Communication, Change Management & Training, Collaboration, and Stakeholder engagement.
 



  





**A selection of responsibilities:** 




**Communication** 



* Plan and execute communication activities related to the company’s transition program
* Align with central cross-brand communication and address company-specific needs
* Ensure clear and consistent messaging across multiple channels, including potential redeployment processes



**Change Management & Training** 



* Support employee transfer through change management and communication aligned with existing strategies
* Organize events like town halls and workshops
* Coordinate training activities with the central project team and content owners



**Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement** 



* Work closely with HR, communication, and labour law teams to align with overall strategies
* Actively participate in international communication workstreams
* Engage key stakeholders—program teams, managers, and employees—to ensure readiness and consistent messaging across brands



  





**Your characteristics** 




 You have a talent for breaking down complex topics and making them easy to understand. Thriving in fast-paced and ever-evolving environments, you’re comfortable navigating multiple stakeholders and shifting priorities. You’re skilled at engaging with people at all levels of an organization – from executives to front-line staff – and you know how to build trust and influence across teams and functions. A true team player, you enjoy working in collaborative, international, and multicultural settings. With a strong sense of focus, you’re excellent at prioritizing and zeroing in on the tasks that bring the most value.
 



  





 Are you the one we are looking for? Please send us your application in English as soon as possible!
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Communication, HR, or other relevant field
* Proven experience in organizational communication and change management
* Proven ability to craft clear, engaging, and effective communication for diverse audiences
* Experience with internal comms channels (intranets, newsletters, presentations, etc.)
* Strong writing and storytelling ability, tailored to both strategic and operational contexts
* Experience working in or supporting cross-functional programs or transformation projects
* Familiarity with modern digital communication platforms (e.g., Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, M365 tools)
* Ability to create visually appealing and accessible materials (e.g., using PowerPoint)
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English, both spoken and written



  





**Meritorious:** 



* Experience in the redeployment process



  





**Contract type and hours** 




 Full-time consulting assignment until 2025-08-31, with possible extension. Start asap.
 



  





**Application** 




 Please apply through our website at perido.se/lediga-jobb/. Simply click the “Apply” button in the job advertisement, fill in your details, and upload your CV. We recommend submitting your application as soon as possible, as the selection process is ongoing. Please note that some details about the assignment and/or client company may have been deliberately disclosed in the advertisement. If your profile matches what the client is looking for and you are contacted by a recruiter, you will receive all the information you need.
 



  





**About Perido** 




 Why is our company named Perido? The name comes from the Latin word
 *Peridoneus* 
 , which means ‘well-matched’. Perido is a consulting and recruitment company specializing in the white-collar sector, dedicated to helping you take the next step in your career. Our vision is to ensure that everyone thrives and feels engaged at work. We have grown steadily since our founding in 2003 and now have over 1,500 employees across the country, including around fifty internal staff at our headquarters in Stockholm and Gothenburg. As a Perido consultant, you’ll play a key role in our organization, growing alongside us while strengthening our clients’ businesses with your skills. Please visit our website www.perido.se for more information.

title: Head of Product Design
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced individual to join the Visa Open Banking Solutions team as the Head of Product Design.
   

  





 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in creating best-in-class user interfaces and experiences, ensuring that users enjoy a seamless and engaging journey throughout the entire product flow. This role demands a keen eye for detail, creativity, and a deep understanding of user-centered design principles to consistently deliver exceptional and intuitive user experiences.
   

  





 The Head of Product Design will be part of the tech and product organization, responsible for the overall design direction and delivery of a complex portfolio of products. In terms of impact, this person will have a key role in shaping the design direction and vision across a large organization, while also improving design efficiency and outcome. The role will have manager responsibility for a team of highly skilled multi-disciplinary designers (3-5 direct reports), and it will also directly contribute to key design projects, for example the ongoing management and upgrade of the design system used by the teams.
   

  





 Key Responsibilities:
   

  




* Communicate and motivate design strategy and decisions throughout Visa Open Banking while offering design direction to teams and stakeholders
* Establish yourself as a key strategic partner in the product and tech organization, effectively manage a wide variety of stakeholders, being the voice of design in the extended leadership team
* Establish design principles and standards for high quality deliveries
* Lead a team of multi-disciplinary designers to support their career, skill progression and growth
* Support and mentor your team in the delivery of design projects to ensure high quality and successful outcomes
* Lead and deliver key design projects yourself, actively contributing to the team’s design output and making sure that you lead by example in the team
* Lead the creation and rollout of a unified design system
* Identify high-impact initiatives that will enable our product teams to deliver an exceptional experience to their end users
* Continuously improve ways of working with design across the organization
* Collaborate and drive integration efforts between Visa Open Banking and the larger Visa design organization



 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications
   

  




* 10 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 8 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters/ MBA/JD/MD) or at least 3 years of work experience with a PhD



 Preferred Qualifications
   

  




* 12 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6+ years of work experience with a PhD
* Excellent UX and UI design skills, demonstrated by a strong portfolio
* 5+ years of design leadership experience in a digital product organization
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a large organization
* Strong leadership skills, with the ability to find a way forward even when things are uncertain and motivate the team
* Experience with user research and usability testing
* Experience with design in Figma
* Experience with managing and maintaining a design system
* Preferably experience in the payments and financial industry


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Communications Specialist with Change Management Experience
description:
We’re now looking for a skilled and proactive Communications Specialist (Change Management) to support a major transformation within the global transportation industry. This full-time assignment runs from April 28th to August 31st and is based in Södertälje, following a hybrid working model.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 As part of a strategic transition program within the People & Culture R&D function, you’ll support the Program Manager and Core Program Team to ensure successful execution of internal communications and change management activities. Your role is instrumental in engaging employees and stakeholders across multiple layers of the organization as they prepare for a major organizational integration.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Plan, develop, and execute internal communication initiatives related to the R&D transition
* Coordinate with central cross-brand communication teams to ensure consistency and alignment
* Support project area leads by identifying communication needs and delivering targeted messaging
* Design and deliver clear, engaging communication throughout the employee transfer process
* Implement change management activities to support employee understanding and engagement
* Coordinate and manage events such as town halls and workshops to support the transition
* Align communication and change strategies with central project teams and local HR functions
* Ensure stakeholder engagement through transparent, consistent messaging across channels



  





**About you:** 




 You are a structured, clear communicator with a strategic mindset and hands-on experience in driving internal communication during change initiatives. Your ability to simplify complex topics and influence across departments makes you a trusted advisor in transformation projects. Comfortable in dynamic, international environments, you thrive when working with diverse stakeholder groups and tight deadlines.
 



  





**Experience and skills:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Communication, HR, Business Administration, or a related field
* Proven experience in organizational communication and change management
* Skilled in crafting clear, engaging content for different audiences and formats
* Familiarity with digital communication tools such as Teams, SharePoint, and M365
* Strong storytelling and presentation skills, with attention to visual clarity and accessibility
* Previous involvement in transformation or cross-functional projects
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, spoken and written
* Experience in redeployment processes is meriting but not required



  





**About the assignment:** 




 For this assignment you will be hired as a full-time consultant by Digitalenta. We offer our consultants a generous package including healthcare allowance, insurance policy, paid vacation days and pension savings. In addition, you'll also have a dedicated consultant manager available throughout your employment with us, in addition to optional networking activities with our network of consultants.

title: Business Marketing Executive - Nordics - Global Business Marketing
description:
**Responsibilities**
 The Nordic Business Marketing team develops events, engagement platforms, marketing communications and strategic industry relations that amplify the TikTok brand and scale our voice. Build our brand and reputation in the industry to drive business growth.
   

  

 Responsibilities
   

 We are looking for a Business Marketing Executive to join our Nordic team - a strategic, smart, creative, and a data-driven marketer. Someone who is high-performing and thrives in a fast paced environment and enjoys creating and scaling within integrated marketing channels. You should be comfortable with a broad range of responsibilities, developing and executing campaigns end-to-end including identifying target segments, developing content, establishing tracking mechanisms, and reporting and iterating on results.
   

  

 The ideal candidate should have good experience of success in supporting and leading in marketing projects, with hands-on experience organising events and working with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver projects on time and on budget. You will report into the Nordic Business Marketing Lead, alongside one other business marketing colleague.
   

  

 Core Responsibilities
   

 - Together with the marketing team, deliver the roadmap of multi-channel marketing activities across all Nordic markets, including events, campaigns, marketing communications, industry partnerships, and client engagement.
   

 - Work closely with local sales team to analyse client pain points and offer insightful contributions and suggestions to overall B2B marketing strategy.
   

 - Project manage and execute strategic marketing initiatives, working closely with internal and external partners (e.g., event agencies, PR/Comms, Product, Marketing Solutions), to deliver ROI-positive activations.
   

 - Measure the performance of marketing campaigns and events, gain insight and adjust strategy and tactics accordingly.
   

 - Bring creativity and innovation to marketing activities, consistently looking to improve the customer experience, enhance deliverables, and stay ahead of industry trends.
   

 - Demonstrate good project management and organisational skills, and demonstrate a self-starter mindset
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Minimum Qualifications
   

 - Executive/Associate level role in a relevant organisation with clear marketing experience and skills
   

 - Outstanding project management skills
   

 - Strong bi-lingual communication skills in English and Swedish
   

  

 Preferred Qualifications
   

 - Strong examples of B2B marketing experience
   

 - Self-starter, a fast learner who is detail-oriented and has critical thinking
   

 - Ability to work independently and as a team across different departments.
   

  

**About TikTok**
 TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.​
   

  

  

**Why Join Us**
 Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.​
   

 We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.​
   

 ​
   

 Diversity & Inclusion​
   

 TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.​

title: Project Manager/PMO – Tenants and Real Estate
description:
**Company Description**
 Creating a future worth living for future generations gets us out of bed every morning. Depending on the project, we are consultants, implementers, or both for sustainable, innovative and economical solutions for real estate, industry, energy and infrastructure. Our more than 6,000 employees at 63 locations worldwide support our customers in interdisciplinary teams. Our thinking is both visionary and realistic. We work independently and as part of a team. With passion and the latest technologies. We unite. Join us at Dreso and let’s create a world we want to live in.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a leading global partner in planning, designing, and managing construction and real estate projects, Drees & Sommer helps companies implement sustainable solutions that create lasting value. With a customer-focus at the center of all we do, we deliver high-quality service and expert guidance to make a real impact.
   

  

 Are you an experienced Project Manager with experience of working close to the tenant organization in real estate projects, looking for your next challenge in a dynamic and innovative environment? Join our growing team in Sweden and bring your entrepreneurial mindset to shape the future of construction. With projects across Sweden, you will be based at our Stockholm office and have the opportunity to contribute to diverse and exciting initiatives. This role combines traditional project management responsibilities with a focus on tenant coordination and fit-out projects.
   

  

* Steering the project management of tenant real estate projects / developments from inception to completion, ensuring that defined project goals (timings, costs, and quality) are met in collaboration with design teams to implement cost-effective solutions
* Act as the key point of contact between tenants and project teams to ensure smooth transitions
* Develop comprehensive relocation plans and coordinate all aspects of tenant moves.
* In collaboration with customer and designers, optimize space utilization and layout to meet tenant needs and enhance functionality
* Lead meetings and consult our customers in all respects
* Oversee compliance with all relevant industry regulations and standards.


**Qualifications**
* A completed master’s degree in civil engineering, architecture, construction management, or similar
* Professional experience in project management, with a strong understanding of tenant fit-outs, relocations, or real estate development.
* Ability to inspire confidence, build strong relationships, and deal with your team, clients, and contractors at all levels in a proactive way
* Knowledge of ABK and other applicable regulations in the industry
* Excellent Swedish and English skills
* International work experience and intercultural competence are a plus
* Whilst not essential, it’s desirable for candidates to have experience or possess a strong interest in cost management and financial control in construction projects.


**Additional Information**
* To ensure your work-life balance, we offer the option of mobile working and part-time models
* We promote your professional and personal development through individual training and further education at the Drees & Sommer Academy
* Our Digital Health Weeks promote both mental and physical health with expert talks and tips
* We promote sustainable mobility with a public transport allowance
* Regular team breakfasts and other team events are an important factor to enhance collaboration and keeping the spirit up!
* In addition to the statutory regulations, we support the compatibility of work and family with the possibility of individual agreements on flexible work

title: Product Analyst - ZEOS Product Operations (all genders)
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
****THE ROLE & THE TEAM****
 As Zalando evolves from Europe’s leading e-commerce platform into the fashion industry’s central ecosystem, this is an exciting moment to join our journey. With a presence in 23 markets, we’re connecting customers, brands, and partners across the continent. Alongside our B2C operations, we’re scaling our B2B business through ZEOS , Zalando’s fulfillment-as-a-service offering. Our vision of
 *“Europe Unlocked”* 
 empowers brands and retailers to simplify e-commerce and expand across borders—leveraging Zalando’s trusted logistics network and infrastructure.
   

  

 As a Product Analyst at ZEOS, reporting directly to the Head of Data. You will work at the intersection of data, product, and logistics. You’ll collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, program managers, and other analysts to provide the insights that shape our product development and operational strategy.
   

  

 You’ll be the go-to expert for product & data insights —diving deep into merchant behavior, operational flows, product usage, stock movements to help teams make smarter, data-informed decisions. Your technical skills in SQL or Python will be essential for processing raw data at scale, while your curiosity and business acumen will help translate numbers into narratives that drive impact.
   

  

 You’ll also contribute to building a stronger foundation for product analytics—helping enhance our data pipelines, structure our analytics layer, and lay the groundwork for experimentation, simulation, and advanced analytics in the future. This position offers an excellent opportunity to leverage your analytical skills in a collaborative and international environment, driving innovation and impact within the rapidly evolving landscape of B2B logistics and e-commerce.
   

  

  

****WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)****
 As a Product Analyst , you will join our dynamic and expanding ZEOS Data team and become a trusted thought partner to our Product, Engineering, and Business teams—driving impact through insights, domain understanding, and a strong sense of ownership. In this role, you’ll
   

  

  

* Be the Analytical Partner for Product & Business You will be an analytical owner of one of the logistics domains.
