title: Senior Data Analyst – Analytics Engineering
description:
**Job Description** **Company**


H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.  



**Role Description**


As an Senior Data Analyst specializing in Analytics Engineering, you will design and build data products, create and maintain data models, and integrate data from multiple sources to support analytics and reporting needs. You will develop dashboards and reports, monitor data product performance, and collaborate with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to provide actionable insights. Your role will involve implementing data governance policies, managing data access, and continuously improving data processes. Additionally, you will mentor your colleagues, lead data projects, and stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices to drive business value.  



**Responsibilities**

* Design and build data products to support analytics and reporting needs, ensuring data quality and integrity.
* Create and maintain data models to optimize data structures for efficient querying and analysis.
* Integrate data from multiple sources to create a unified view of product performance, collaborating with data scientists and analysts.
* Develop dashboards and reports to provide insights into product performance and user behavior, automating reporting processes for timely delivery.
* Monitor and evaluate the performance of data products, defining and measuring KPIs to ensure alignment with strategic business goals.
* Work closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to understand data needs and provide actionable insights, presenting findings and recommendations.
* Implement data governance policies to ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations, managing data access and permissions.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering and analytics, proactively identifying opportunities to improve data products and systems.
* Mentor junior colleagues, leading data projects and initiatives to drive business value.
* Establish best practices for data product development and share knowledge across the organization to foster a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.

 **Qualifications**  



* Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* High proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
* Experience with data transformation tools such as dbt.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
* Experience with version control systems like Git.
* Strong skills in data visualization tools such as PowerBI.
* Solid understanding of data modeling principles and best practices.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services.
* Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and technologies.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to translate complex business requirements into technical specifications.
* Experience with data governance and ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.
* Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage and persuade stakeholders.
* Proven ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members.
* Continuous learning mindset and ability to stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering and analytics.

 **Additional information**


This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible. We will review and interview candidates ongoing. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.

title: Senior Data Analyst – Advanced Analytics
description:
**Job Description** **Role Description**


As a Senior Data Analyst specializing in Advanced Analytics, you will lead complex analytics projects, mentor team members, and enhance our data landscape with advanced analytical techniques. You will leverage your expertise in data analytics, machine learning, and statistical modeling to provide actionable insights and drive data-driven decision-making. Your role will involve collaborating with stakeholders to understand business needs, interpret predictive models, and implementing innovative solutions to solve complex business problems. Additionally, you will stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in advanced analytics to continuously improve our data processes and systems.  



**Responsibilities**

* Lead complex analytics projects to provide actionable insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
* Contribute to developing predictive models to forecast future trends and outcomes
* Analyze the output of machine learning algorithms to automate decision-making processes and improve business operations.
* Conduct advanced statistical analysis to understand data distributions, relationships, and trends.
* Design and conduct experiments to test hypotheses and assess the business impact of changes in strategy or new features
* Create and maintain data models to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
* Develop dashboards and reports to visualize insights and communicate findings to stakeholders.
* Collaborate with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into analytical solutions.
* Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders, using data-driven insights to influence decision-making.
* Mentor junior data analysts and provide guidance on advanced analytical techniques and best practices.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in advanced analytics to continuously improve data processes and systems.

**Qualifications**  



* Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* High proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R.
* Proficiency in data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or similar.
* Solid understanding of statistical modeling and advanced analytical techniques.
* Experience with data mining and data wrangling techniques.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services.
* Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and technologies.
* Strong business acumen and the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Advanced presentation skills, with the ability to engage and persuade senior stakeholders with data-driven insights.
* Experience with designing and conducting experiments to test hypotheses and assess the impact of changes.
* Proven ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members.
* Continuous learning mindset and ability to stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in advanced analytics.

 **Additional information**


This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible. We will review and interview candidates ongoing. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.

title: Digital Transformation Associate
description:

 **Start Date: Q3 2025**

 **Take Your Career Beyond the Ordinary**


Welcome to GO Beyond—Ericsson’s flagship early-career rotational program designed to develop the next generation of problem solvers, innovators, and changemakers with 1-3 years of experience.


You’ve made an impact in your first role, and now you’re ready for the next challenge—something dynamic, fast-paced, and built for real career growth.

You’ll join a team working on real business challenges, reshaping Ericsson's operations.


As a Digital Transformation Associate, you will play an integral role in reshaping Ericsson's operations by contributing to large-scale digital transformation initiatives. This is not an observational role—you will be directly involved in modernising systems, enhancing cloud-based solutions, and driving AI and automation integration.


Throughout this journey, you will be exposed to cutting-edge technologies, receive training in digital transformation strategies, and gain hands-on experience in Six Sigma methodologies for process improvement. You will be supported by mentors and peers who will provide guidance, feedback, and professional development opportunities.


As part of the program, you’ll also have the opportunity to learn **Six Sigma** methodologies for process improvement.


Mentors and buddies who provide guidance and feedback will support you throughout your journey.


In your first few months, you’ll engage in meaningful work and learn to apply the latest tools and techniques.


As you progress, you’ll expand your skill set and build relationships across departments while contributing to more significant digital initiatives at Ericsson.

title: Digital Transformation Associate
description:
**Locations: Sweden, Kista**  

 **Start Date: Q3 2025**

 **Take Your Career Beyond the Ordinary**


Welcome to GO Beyond—Ericsson’s flagship early-career rotational program designed to develop the next generation of problem solvers, innovators, and changemakers with 1-3 years of experience.


You’ve made an impact in your first role, and now you’re ready for the next challenge—something dynamic, fast-paced, and built for real career growth.

 **What Will I Be Doing at Ericsson?**


You’ll join a team working on real business challenges, reshaping Ericsson's operations.


As a Digital Transformation Associate, you will play an integral role in reshaping Ericsson's operations by contributing to large-scale digital transformation initiatives. This is not an observational role—you will be directly involved in modernising systems, enhancing cloud-based solutions, and driving AI and automation integration.


Throughout this journey, you will be exposed to cutting-edge technologies, receive training in digital transformation strategies, and gain hands-on experience in Six Sigma methodologies for process improvement. You will be supported by mentors and peers who will provide guidance, feedback, and professional development opportunities.


As part of the program, you’ll also have the opportunity to learn **Six Sigma** methodologies for process improvement.


Mentors and buddies who provide guidance and feedback will support you throughout your journey.


In your first few months, you’ll engage in meaningful work and learn to apply the latest tools and techniques.


As you progress, you’ll expand your skill set and build relationships across departments while contributing to more significant digital initiatives at Ericsson.

 **What Makes GO Beyond Different?**

* **Permanent Role with a 12-month program**: Start in Digital Transformation, rotate through another business unit, then return to your permanent role.
* **Exposure to leadership and hands-on involvement** in digital strategy and transformation projects.
* **Global teamwork** with colleagues across India, Sweden, and other locations.

**Your GO Beyond Journey**

* **First 6 months**: Focus on Cloud IT adoption, AI, and automation to drive transformation.
* **Next 6 months:** Rotate to another business unit to expand your expertise, contributing to broader strategic initiatives.
* **Permanent Role**: After the rotation, return to your permanent base and work on high-impact digital transformation projects.

 **Who Thrives in This Program?**

**We are looking for innovators who thrive in dynamic environments. You should have:**

* 1-3 years of experience in digital transformation, IT strategy, AI, or cloud technologies.
* Strong problem-solving and strategic thinking capabilities.
* Excellent communication skills to manage cross-functional relationships.

**Why Choose GO Beyond?**

* Cutting-edge work in AI, automation, and cloud technology.
* Growth opportunities into senior leadership roles in digital transformation and business strategy.
* Global exposure to high-impact projects and senior leadership.

 **Group Digital Transformation**

**About the Team**


You’ll join a dynamic and diverse team of **technology leaders** in the **Digital Transformation** space. This team is at the forefront of Ericsson’s **global digital initiatives**, focusing on transforming our operations by leveraging **AI**, **cloud platforms**, and **automation**.


The team works collaboratively across various departments, enabling Ericsson to stay ahead of technological advancements and implement digital solutions that drive business growth.

**What the Team is Working On:**

* Modernising Ericsson's **legacy IT systems** to improve business processes and efficiency.
* Implementing **AI-driven solutions** that improve decision-making and operational excellence.
* Driving the digital adoption strategy across the organisation to ensure seamless integration of **cloud-based systems**, **automation**, and **machine learning** tools.

**Why You Should Work for This Team:**  

Joining this team means being part of a **transformative journey** in one of the largest tech companies globally. You’ll gain exposure to **cutting-edge technologies**, work with **senior leaders**, and have the opportunity to influence key digital projects.


If you are passionate about driving real change, have an appetite for innovation, and want to shape the future of technology, this team is where you can thrive.

  

https://www.ericsson.com/en/careers/student-young-professionals/early-career-rotation

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. title: Digital Transformation Associate
description:
**Locations: Sweden, Kista**  

 **Start Date: Q3 2025**

 **Take Your Career Beyond the Ordinary**


Welcome to GO Beyond—Ericsson’s flagship early-career rotational program designed to develop the next generation of problem solvers, innovators, and changemakers with 1-3 years of experience.


You’ve made an impact in your first role, and now you’re ready for the next challenge—something dynamic, fast-paced, and built for real career growth.

 **What Will I Be Doing at Ericsson?**


You’ll join a team working on real business challenges, reshaping Ericsson's operations.


As a Digital Transformation Associate, you will play an integral role in reshaping Ericsson's operations by contributing to large-scale digital transformation initiatives. This is not an observational role—you will be directly involved in modernising systems, enhancing cloud-based solutions, and driving AI and automation integration.


Throughout this journey, you will be exposed to cutting-edge technologies, receive training in digital transformation strategies, and gain hands-on experience in Six Sigma methodologies for process improvement. You will be supported by mentors and peers who will provide guidance, feedback, and professional development opportunities.


As part of the program, you’ll also have the opportunity to learn **Six Sigma** methodologies for process improvement.


Mentors and buddies who provide guidance and feedback will support you throughout your journey.


In your first few months, you’ll engage in meaningful work and learn to apply the latest tools and techniques.


As you progress, you’ll expand your skill set and build relationships across departments while contributing to more significant digital initiatives at Ericsson.

 **What Makes GO Beyond Different?**

* **Permanent Role with a 12-month program**: Start in Digital Transformation, rotate through another business unit, then return to your permanent role.
* **Exposure to leadership and hands-on involvement** in digital strategy and transformation projects.
* **Global teamwork** with colleagues across India, Sweden, and other locations.

**Your GO Beyond Journey**

* **First 6 months**: Focus on Cloud IT adoption, AI, and automation to drive transformation.
* **Next 6 months:** Rotate to another business unit to expand your expertise, contributing to broader strategic initiatives.
* **Permanent Role**: After the rotation, return to your permanent base and work on high-impact digital transformation projects.

 **Who Thrives in This Program?**

**We are looking for innovators who thrive in dynamic environments. You should have:**

* 1-3 years of experience in digital transformation, IT strategy, AI, or cloud technologies.
* Strong problem-solving and strategic thinking capabilities.
* Excellent communication skills to manage cross-functional relationships.

**Why Choose GO Beyond?**

* Cutting-edge work in AI, automation, and cloud technology.
* Growth opportunities into senior leadership roles in digital transformation and business strategy.
* Global exposure to high-impact projects and senior leadership.

 **Group Digital Transformation**

The team works collaboratively across various departments, enabling Ericsson to stay ahead of technological advancements and implement digital solutions that drive business growth.

**What the Team is Working On:**

* Modernising Ericsson's **legacy IT systems** to improve business processes and efficiency.
* Implementing **AI-driven solutions** that improve decision-making and operational excellence.
* Driving the digital adoption strategy across the organisation to ensure seamless integration of **cloud-based systems**, **automation**, and **machine learning** tools.

Joining this team means being part of a **transformative journey** in one of the largest tech companies globally. You’ll gain exposure to **cutting-edge technologies**, work with **senior leaders**, and have the opportunity to influence key digital projects.

description:
**Locations:** Sweden, Kista  

**Start Date:** Q3 2025

 **Take Your Career Beyond the Ordinary**


Welcome to **GO Beyond**—Ericsson’s flagship early-career rotational program designed to develop the next generation of problem solvers, innovators, and changemakers with **1-3 years of experience**. You’ve made an impact in your first role, and now you’re ready for the next challenge—something dynamic, fast-paced, and built for real career growth.

 **What Will I Be Doing at Ericsson?**

* Lead **change management** efforts to **drive platform adoption** and enhance digital transformation across Ericsson.
* Work with **cross-functional teams** to **accelerate the integration of new technologies** (AI, automation, blockchain).
* **Engage stakeholders** to align on platform adoption strategies and increase internal platform usage.
* Develop and execute **strategic communication plans** to improve platform engagement across teams.

 **What Makes GO Beyond Different?**

* **Permanent Role** with a **12-month program**: Begin in **EIT Enablement**, rotate to another business unit, and return to your permanent role.
* **Global teamwork** with colleagues in multiple locations.
* Opportunity to shape **Ericsson’s digital transformation strategy** and **AI adoption**.

 **Your GO Beyond Journey**

* **First 6 months:** Focus on enabling platform adoption and leading **change management** efforts in **EIT Enablement**.
* **Next 6 months:** Rotate to another unit and broaden your experience, contributing to larger organisational transformation projects.
* **Permanent Role:** Return to **EIT Enablement** as a platform adoption and change management leader.

 **Who Thrives in This Program?**


We are looking for change leaders who are passionate about **platform adoption** and **digital transformation**. You should have:

* 1-3 years of experience in **change management**, **platform adoption**, or **digital strategy**.
* Excellent communication and **stakeholder management** skills.
* Ability to **influence change** across multiple business units.

 **Why Choose GO Beyond?**

* Work on **AI-driven platforms** and **cutting-edge technologies**.
* Access to **continuous learning** and **leadership development** opportunities.
* Exposure to **global teams** and high-impact projects in **digital transformation**.

The **EIT Enablement** team is a highly collaborative group that drives the adoption and **enablement of digital platforms** across the Organisation. Comprised of technology strategists, platform specialists, and change management experts, the team ensures that Ericsson’s **automation**, **AI**, and **analytics** tools are adopted successfully across various business units. This team directly impacts the company’s digital transformation efforts, ensuring that **technology solutions** are aligned with business needs.

* Collaborating with key business stakeholders to align digital solutions with strategic objectives, ensuring smooth integration across functions.

You will be supported by mentors and peers who will provide guidance, feedback, and professional development opportunities.


As part of the program, you’ll also have the opportunity to learn **Six Sigma** methodologies for process improvement.


Mentors and buddies who provide guidance and feedback will support you throughout your journey.


In your first few months, you’ll engage in meaningful work and learn to apply the latest tools and techniques.


As you progress, you’ll expand your skill set and build relationships across departments while contributing to more significant digital initiatives at Ericsson.

 **What Makes GO Beyond Different?**

* **Permanent Role with a 12-month program**: Start in Digital Transformation, rotate through another business unit, then return to your permanent role.
* **Exposure to leadership and hands-on involvement** in digital strategy and transformation projects.
* **Global teamwork** with colleagues across India, Sweden, and other locations.

**Your GO Beyond Journey**

* **First 6 months**: Focus on Cloud IT adoption, AI, and automation to drive transformation.
* **Next 6 months:** Rotate to another business unit to expand your expertise, contributing to broader strategic initiatives.
* **Permanent Role**: After the rotation, return to your permanent base and work on high-impact digital transformation projects.

 **Who Thrives in This Program?**

**We are looking for innovators who thrive in dynamic environments. You should have:**

* 1-3 years of experience in digital transformation, IT strategy, AI, or cloud technologies.
* Strong problem-solving and strategic thinking capabilities.
* Excellent communication skills to manage cross-functional relationships.

**Why Choose GO Beyond?**

* Cutting-edge work in AI, automation, and cloud technology.
* Growth opportunities into senior leadership roles in digital transformation and business strategy.
* Global exposure to high-impact projects and senior leadership.

 **Group Digital Transformation**

**About the Team**


You’ll join a dynamic and diverse team of **technology leaders** in the **Digital Transformation** space. This team is at the forefront of Ericsson’s **global digital initiatives**, focusing on transforming our operations by leveraging **AI**, **cloud platforms**, and **automation**.


The team works collaboratively across various departments, enabling Ericsson to stay ahead of technological advancements and implement digital solutions that drive business growth.

**What the Team is Working On:**

* Modernising Ericsson's **legacy IT systems** to improve business processes and efficiency.
* Implementing **AI-driven solutions** that improve decision-making and operational excellence.
* Driving the digital adoption strategy across the organisation to ensure seamless integration of **cloud-based systems**, **automation**, and **machine learning** tools.

**Why You Should Work for This Team:**  

Joining this team means being part of a **transformative journey** in one of the largest tech companies globally. You’ll gain exposure to **cutting-edge technologies**, work with **senior leaders**, and have the opportunity to influence key digital projects.


If you are passionate about driving real change, have an appetite for innovation, and want to shape the future of technology, this team is where you can thrive.

  

https://www.ericsson.com/en/careers/student-young-professionals/early-career-rotation

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Computer Vision and Perception Engineer, ABB Marine & Ports
description:
**Computer Vision and Perception Engineer, ABB Marine & Ports**
===============================================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **Your role and responsibilities**


In this role You will be part of the sensor team at ABB Marine & Ports, and contribute to the development of our automation systems for terminal cranes and Marine Pilot solution for autonomous ships as specialist in computer vision and perception. Responsibilities in the role include: • Drive progress of our research and development in sensor- and perception applications for autonomous terminal cranes and autonomous vessels. • Actively work with development of perception algorithms for both vision- and point cloud (LIDAR) data using techniques such as ROS2, OpenCV, PCL, Open3D, TensorFlow and PyTorch working in C/C++, Python and MATLAB in embedded systems and Microsoft Azure platform. • Actively participate in cross-functional agile teams. • Work with both R&D in new product development while working with enhancements to existing products in cooperation with customers. • Pursuing new ideas for technological innovation and sharing expertise in team meetings and technical reports. • Expanding your knowledge base of customer needs and technological developments in the perception domain.

### **Qualifications for the role**

* Masters’ degree in computer science, robotics, physics, mechatronics, or other relevant engineering and science domain.
* Good understanding of machine learning, computer vision and machine perception theory.
* Experience from working with vision and sensor applications and technologies such as OpenCV, PCL/Open3D, Linux, ROS, Docker, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Azure ML.
* Open to travel globally and support in pilot projects as specialist in sensor applications.
* A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach, and strong communication skills.
* A high level of self-motivation, curiosity, and desire to learn about new technologies.

### **More about us**


ABB Marine & Ports supplies world-leading technologies that are driving the evolution of sustainable shipping. Electrical propulsion, data-driven decision support and integrated solutions for ship and shore from ABB are paving the way to a zero-emission marine industry, providing greater efficiency and reliability to shipowners, and preparing vessels to meet the demands of tomorrow. Our automation and electrical solutions are making port and terminal operations safer, greener and more productive. ABB Marine & Ports operates in 26 countries and has 2,000 employees. www.abb.com/marine Recruiting Manager Pontus Klang, +46 722 15 94 09, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Johannes Westermark Hester. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Affärsanalytiker
description:
*Är du en analytiker som älskar att hantera stora datamängder och att bidra med din kunskap till viktiga datadrivna beslut inom organisationen via vårt dedikerade datastrategiteam? Letar du efter nya utmaningar i en organisation som konstant utvecklas och där varje medarbetare brinner för sitt yrke, vilket bidrar till ett positivt och välkomnande arbetsklimat? Då tycker vi du ska läsa vidare.*

**Om jobbet:**

  

Som Affärsanalytiker kommer du att spela en central roll i vår organisation genom att driva och leda analysprojekt som ger djupgående, datadrivna insikter kopplade till Evidensias prissättning, omsättning, volymutveckling och journaldata i vårt affärssystem Provet Cloud. Genom att ta fram och visualisera relevanta analyser med fokus på harmonisering av arbetssätt, bidrar du med beslutsstöd till både centrala och lokala beslutsfattare i organisationen.


Du förväntas identifiera och lyfta fram områden med outnyttjad affärspotential, synliggöra avvikelser och trender samt analysera faktorer som påverkar intäktsflödet. I rollen ingår även att följa upp verksamhetsresultat och rekommendera konkreta åtgärder som skapar värde för verksamheten. Med dina insikter bidrar du till ökad förståelse för verksamhetens prestation och stöttar medarbetare i frågor relaterade till debitering och affärslogik.

**Vad erbjuder vi?**

  

Hos oss får du arbeta i en dynamisk, utvecklingsorienterad miljö där du har stort inflytande och möjlighet att påverka på hög nivå. Du får vara en del av en organisation där medarbetarna drivs av engagemanget för djurens bästa och ett gemensamt mål att ständigt förbättra vår vård och våra arbetssätt.


Vi erbjuder:

* Ett varierat och meningsfullt arbete där du gör verklig skillnad
* Möjlighet till utveckling i en nordisk kontext
* Stort mandat att driva frågor inom analys och verksamhetsutveckling
* Ett välkomnande team och bra förmåner

**Vem söker vi?**

  

Vi söker dig som har vana att arbeta lösningsorienterat i projektform med stora datamängder med hög noggrannhet. Din starka analytiska förmåga och fleråriga erfarenhet inom liknande roller kommer att vara en nyckel till framgång. Förmågan att arbeta både självständigt och i team är viktigt för att passa in i vårt dynamiska arbetsklimat. För att lyckas i rollen bör du vara lyhörd för behov och ha en förmåga att självständigt prioritera ditt arbete samt kunna mottagaranpassa komplexa frågeställningar. Stor vikt kommer läggas på personliga egenskaper för att passa i rollen.


**Du har:**


* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom ekonomi, systemvetenskap, civilingenjör, eller motsvarande
* Flerårig erfarenhet av kvalificerat analysarbete
* Vana att arbeta med stora datamängder och komplexa frågeställningar
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Excel och PowerPoint
* Erfarenhet av SQL och Power BI, eller snarlika analysverktyg

**Meriterande är:**

* Erfarenhet från tjänstesektorn, gärna djurvård eller humanvård
* Kunskap i Python eller andra programmeringsspråk
* Erfarenhet inom journalsystemet Provet Cloud

Dokumenterad erfarenhet av förändringsledning eller verksamhetsutveckling  
* 

  

**Ort:** Stockholm, Supportkontoret

 **Omfattning:** Heltid, med möjlighet till distansarbete några dagar i veckan.

 **Sista ansökningsdag:**  

16/5. Urval kan komma att ske löpande, så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt.

**För information:**

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig till Chef för Datastrategi, Lina Skytt, lina.skytt@evidensia.se eller tel. 070 085 80 08

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan**

 *Evidensia Djursjukvård erbjuder trygg och personlig vård för hundar, katter, exotiska djur och hästar. På lokala djurkliniker och specialiserade djursjukhus i hela Sverige får viktiga familjemedlemmar hjälp med förebyggande friskvård, primärvård, akutvård, avancerad kirurgi och rehabilitering. Varje möte med djur och ägare ska göra skillnad och tillsammans tar våra engagerade medarbetare emot över 500 000 patientbesök per år.* *Tillsammans arbetar vi för att driva den veterinärmedicinska utvecklingen framåt, för djurens bästa varje dag.*
company_description: We are a global leader in veterinary care, dedicated to providing exceptional animal care. Our network of first-opinion practices, referral hospitals, and emergency care centres.

title: Software Engineer - Engineering Productivity
description:
**Help Shape the Future of Development at Nordnet: Join Our Engineering Productivity Team!**


Innovation and empowering our developers are at the heart of Nordnet's engineering culture. We operate with a modern, microservices-based architecture featuring highly available and scalable backend applications, alongside advanced CI/CD and data pipelines built on technologies like Java, Spring Boot, PubSub, and Kubernetes. Our commitment to continuous delivery means we release to production over 100 times a day.


We're looking for a passionate Software Engineer to join Nordnet's Engineering department and our dedicated **Engineering Productivity team**. In this team you'll be improving the developer experience across the Engineering organization. Our team acts as an internal catalyst, focused on making our developers more efficient, informed, and successful.

 **Your daily work will involve**

* **Building and supporting our "Know Your Maintenance" framework**: Empowering development teams with crucial technical insights for proactive maintenance.
* **Developing tools and visualizations for complex migrations**: Making large-scale changes smoother and more transparent for everyone involved.
* **Creating and maintaining shared tooling, such as custom linters**: Simplifying common development tasks and promoting best practices across teams.
* **Identifying and addressing pain points in the developer workflow**: Proactively seeking opportunities to improve efficiency and reduce friction.
* **Collaborating and communicating closely with other development teams**: Understanding their needs and building solutions that truly make a difference.
* **Maintaining and evolving our internal developer portal based on Backstage**: Ensuring it's a valuable and user-friendly hub for developers.
  

**This is you**


You are a software engineer who thrives on solving challenges and empowering others. You're driven to learn new technologies and share your knowledge and passion. Your work style is organized, methodical, and adaptable, contributing positively to the team's dynamics and our ability to deliver impactful solutions.


You bring previous experience in software engineering in a cloud-based environment. You have a natural curiosity for technology and a knack for selecting the right tools for the job. You also enjoy communicating your ideas clearly and collaborating effectively with others. An MSc degree in Computing/Engineering or equivalent is preferred, and familiarity with agile methodologies is essential. While experience and interest in savings and investments is a plus, it's not a requirement – your passion for developer productivity is what truly matters.

**As an engineer on our team, you are**:

  

* A strong communicator, transparent in your work, and an active listener.
* Results-oriented, valuing data and outcomes over ego.
* A continuous learner, always seeking opportunities for growth.
* Passionate about automation and streamlining processes.
* Contributing to a positive and productive developer experience.
  

**You have experience in**:

* Designing, building, and maintaining scalable and reliable systems.
* Modern software engineering principles and practices.
* Working with containerization and orchestration technologies.
* Implementing solutions for technical insights and data analysis.
  

**Concrete qualifications**:

* MSc degree in Computer Science or equivalent with more than 3 years experience working in an agile environment
* Experience in one or more of the following languages: TypeScript, Java, Golang
* Experience in building infrastructure using Terraform and similar technologies
* Experience with at least one of the big cloud providers
* Experience in GCP, BigQuery and VertexAI is meriting but not required.
  

**Culture at Nordnet Engineering:**

* A just-do-it attitude, where everyone feels enabled and valued, regardless of their position or role.
* We live and breathe technology taking pride in our work
* We take a scientific approach by experimenting and learning
* We are curious and respectful, listen and ask questions with the intent to understand, while embracing different perspectives
* We assume positive intent in others and foster a culture where speaking up and challenging ideas is welcomed.
* A commitment to work-life balance, ensuring flexibility and support for our employees’ well-being.


**This is us**  

  

At Nordnet, technology is at the core of everything we do, driving innovation and maintaining our competitive edge. We’ve made over 30 000 production releases this year, releasing our web every other hour and our app every two days.  

  

We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus  

on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and  

you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of  

sharp and committed colleagues.  

  

Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having  

a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly  

atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts  

and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values –  

passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what  

you do.  

  

29 years ago, Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again with the aim of creating the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology.  

  

Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?  

  

**Application**  

Apply today! – Please note that we only accept applications through our recruitment system. We do not consider email applications.  

  

At Nordnet, we value diversity and inclusion, and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can succeed.  

  

As part of our recruitment process, we conduct mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing.  

  

We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Product Manager
description:
#### **Join Telavox as a Product Manager**

We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our team at Telavox in Malmö. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who enjoys working across technology, business, and design and is eager to drive growth in the ever-evolving UCaaS (Unified Communications as a Service) and Communication industry. If you’re passionate about creating customer-centric solutions, collaborating with diverse teams, and driving product vision, we’d love to hear from you!

#### **About the job**

  

As a Product Manager at Telavox, you’ll shape the direction of our UCaaS Platform and related communication solutions, ensuring they meet customer needs, deliver real value, and achieve commercial success. You’ll collaborate with engineers, designers, marketers, and sales professionals to define roadmaps, prioritize features, and bring innovative solutions to market. Your focus will include identifying opportunities to drive revenue growth, elevate our UCaaS offerings, and ensure our products stand out in a competitive landscape.

 **Your day-to-day work may include:**

  

* Define and communicate a clear product vision and strategy for UCaaS and complementary solutions that resonate with both internal teams and external partners.
* Partner with development teams to create intuitive UCaaS solutions that exceed customer expectations.
* Build and manage product roadmaps to align with company goals, market opportunities, and insights gained from analytics, feedback, and emerging trends in the UCaaS landscape.
* Engage with customers and stakeholders to uncover opportunities and ensure our products stay ahead of the curve in unified communications.
* Collaborate closely with marketing, sales, and operations teams to develop go-to-market strategies, deliver impactful product launches, and drive commercial growth for our UCaaS portfolio.

#### **About you**

  

We’re looking for a Product Manager who thrives on taking initiative, driving results, and owning accountability. You’re comfortable leading from both the technical and customer perspectives, bringing energy and determination to every challenge. You enjoy solving problems, uniting diverse teams, and turning ideas into impactful realities. Your curiosity, empathy, and determination will help us continue to grow and innovate.

 **Key skills and experience we’re looking for:**

  

* A deep understanding of the market landscape, customer needs, and emerging trends in enterprise communication, with experience in UCaaS or related fields.
* Experience as a B2B Product Manager, ideally in SaaS, Cloud, or Telco environments.
* Expertise in building and scaling platform businesses, with a strong understanding of ecosystem dynamics and partner integrations.
* Ability to guide agile product teams through the full lifecycle, from concept to launch, while balancing technical and business priorities.
* Comfortable using data and insights to make informed decisions, set priorities, and evaluate success.
* Skilled at bringing diverse teams together, sharing a clear vision, and aligning stakeholders across functions.
* Committed to understanding and addressing customer pain points to create valuable, impactful solutions.

**Good-to-have skills:**

  

* Familiarity with tools and techniques for customer engagement, monetization, and retention.
* Experience working with global markets and creating scalable solutions for diverse audiences.


Your passion for new communication technologies, talent for creating great user experiences, and proactive approach make you perfect for this role—ready to step up, take ownership, and deliver results.

#### **Join us at Telavox**


Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. As a digital mobile operator, we develop and own our all-in-one communication platform, which integrates telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centers, giving businesses a smarter way to connect.  

  

Today, we’re a thriving company with 1.9 billion SEK in revenue and 500+ Telavoxers across nine countries. We embrace AI and automation to push the boundaries of business communication.  

  

We offer flexible work options and adaptable hours, giving you the freedom to balance life and career while staying connected to our vibrant Telavox culture.

### **How to apply!**

  

At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone.  

  

We’re always on the lookout for great talent, so applications are reviewed continuously. If you're ready to be part of an innovative, AI-driven telecom company, apply today with your CV and cover letter in English.

  

For any questions, feel free to reach out to Talent Acquisition Partner Ami Faraguna at ann-marie.faraguna@telavox.com  



**Learn more about what we do! ️**

title: AI Solutions architect
description:
**Location:** **EMEA**  



**Job description:**

**As an AI/ML Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing and overseeing the architecture of AI and machine learning solutions. You will work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure that our AI/ML initiatives are scalable, robust, and aligned with business objectives. Your expertise in machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing (NLP), and generative AI will be crucial in guiding the development and deployment of advanced AI solutions.**  



**Your responsibilities include:**  

* **Design and architect end-to-end AI/ML solutions that meet business requirements and technical specifications.**
* **Develop and implement scalable machine learning and deep learning models, ensuring they integrate seamlessly into existing systems.**
* **Create architectures for NLP applications, including text processing, sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, and language modelling.**
* **Leverage generative AI and large language models (LLMs) to develop innovative applications.**
* **Collaborate with data engineers to design data pipelines and ensure data quality and accessibility.**
* **Provide technical leadership and guidance to data scientists and engineers throughout the development lifecycle.**
* **Evaluate and select appropriate AI/ML tools, frameworks, and technologies to meet project needs.**
* **Ensure best practices in AI/ML model development, including versioning, testing, and validation.**
* **Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate them into architectural designs.**
* **Communicate complex AI/ML concepts and solutions effectively to non-technical stakeholders.**
**About GIT:**  

**Group IT is an internal Capgemini function that delivers a comprehensive portfolio of technology services to the entire Capgemini Group. We look after more than 360,000 employees in countries and continents across the world, around the clock. We work with a wide variety of business lines, each requiring specific IT solutions and support. With people from a diverse range of cultures, all collaborating to achieve a common set of goals.**  



**Qualifications:**

* **Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.**
* **Proven experience (8+ years) in designing and implementing AI/ML solutions, with a strong focus on machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and generative AI.**
* **Extensive experience with machine learning algorithms, model development, and deployment.**
* **Proficiency in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras.**
* **Strong expertise in NLP techniques and tools, including experience with LLMs like Gemini, GPT, BERT, etc.**
* **Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and their AI/ML services.**
* **Knowledge of big data technologies and tools such as Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka.**
* **Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and Java.**
* **Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to design robust, scalable AI/ML architectures.**
* **Strong communication skills, with the ability to present technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.**
* **Experience in leading and mentoring technical teams.**

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* **Experience with MLOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment of machine learning models.**
* **Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.**

**Capgemini text (obligatory):**  

**When you join Capgemini, you don’t just start a new job, you become a part of something bigger.**  

**Capgemini’s purpose is to “unleash human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future”. Established in 1967 and now headquartered in Paris, we have become one of the largest technology consulting firms providing services to government, the environment, retail, health, manufacturing and aerospace. We live by our brand values: honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, fun, modesty and team spirit.****GET THE FUTURE YOU WANT**

**Skills (competencies)**
-------------------------

title: Service Integration Manager - Go Beyond Program
description:
Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Service Integration Manager Go Beyond Program**
-------------------------------------------------

 **Locations: Flexible (Sweden, Kista)**  

 **Start Date: Q3 2025**

 **Take Your Career Beyond the Ordinary**


Welcome to **GO Beyond**—Ericsson’s flagship early-career rotational program designed to develop the next generation of problem solvers, innovators, and changemakers with **1-3 years of experience**. You’ve made an impact in your first role, and now you’re ready for the next challenge—something dynamic, fast-paced, and built for real career growth.


https://www.ericsson.com/en/careers/student-young-professionals/early-career-rotation

 **What Will I Be Doing at Ericsson?**


You’ll join a team shaping **Ericsson's data architecture** to ensure seamless integration across our **IT operations**.  

You’ll design and manage data solutions aligning with business goals and IT capabilities, working on data integration, data flows, and **modelling**. You won’t just be involved in the technical aspects—you’ll be a critical player in **aligning the enterprise data model**, ensuring **data governance** and operational efficiency.  

In your first few months, you’ll build relationships with internal stakeholders and get hands-on experience with **data architecture** and **enterprise IT systems**. As you progress, you’ll contribute to designing solutions that can evolve with Ericsson's ever-changing business landscape.


You’ll also have access to cutting-edge **AI-driven tools**, **cloud platforms**, and **automation frameworks**, and you'll learn to navigate complex data environments.


You will also benefit from mentorship and structured learning programs, which will prepare you for a future Solution or Enterprise Architect role.

**What Makes GO Beyond Different?**
-----------------------------------

* **Permanent Role** with a **12-month program**: Start in **EIT Core Operations**, rotate to another business unit, and return to **EIT Core Operations** as your permanent base.
* **Exposure to leadership** and hands-on involvement in **data architecture**, **integration**, and **analytics projects**.
* **Global teamwork** with colleagues across Sweden, India, and other locations.

**Your GO Beyond Journey**

* **First 6 months:** Focus on understanding Ericsson’s **enterprise data needs**, designing **data assets** to meet business demands, and aligning **data architecture** with **existing IT infrastructure**.
* **Next 6 months:** Rotate to another unit and work on broader strategic initiatives related to **data management**, **modelling**, and evolving **data products**.
* **Permanent Role:** Return to **EIT Core Operations** as a data strategy and architecture leader.
**How to Apply**
----------------

  

* Click **Apply Now** and check out our website for more details.
* We review applications promptly—expect to hear from us soon!

**Application Process:**

* Recruiter Screening
* Online Assessments
* Panel Interview
* Final Hiring Manager Interview

 **Why You Should Work for This Team:**


The **EIT Core Operations** team at Ericsson is a diverse and highly collaborative group of professionals dedicated to **transforming Ericsson’s data architecture** and enhancing the company's operational efficiency. With a team size of approximately **100 people**, the team works at the intersection of **IT operations**, **data management**, and **digital transformation**.


The primary objective of this team is to design and maintain **data assets** that align with **business goals**, ensuring **data consistency** and enabling better decision-making across the organisation. As part of your journey, you will be involved in developing **data strategies**, **data integration**, and **data architecture** to meet the enterprise's needs and support growth.


Working in this team means being part of an innovative, **high-impact environment** where **AI**, **cloud platforms**, and **automation** are crucial in reshaping Ericsson’s operations. The team values a **collaborative culture**, and you'll work alongside colleagues across the globe to drive change and contribute to the company’s digital evolution.


By joining **EIT Core Operations**, you will gain invaluable experience working with the latest **data technologies** and have opportunities for **personal development** through **mentorship**, **training programs**, and exposure to **senior leadership**. You will contribute to the current success and help **shape the future** of Ericsson’s data and IT infrastructure.

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Senior, Pre-Sales
description:
As Cloud Conversion's Presales, you will prepare and conduct Cloud Conversion presentation of JEEVES with sales team.  

You will act as a technical resource and liaison between the sales team, customer and professional services team.
Responsibilities


* Preparing and conducting Cloud Conversion presentation with Sales.
* Provides solutions to a diverse range of complex business problem.
* Act as a technical resource and liaison between the sales team, customer and professional service team.
* Understand customer needs, translate them into the conversion process and into JEEVES.
* Designing & implementing custom solutions based on customer requirements.
* Act as a liaison with Professional Services to describe the solution sold (handover)
* Conduct customer webinars.


  

The list above is not exhaustive and you may be asked to undertake reasonable additional duties/projects.
Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


* Knowledge of JEEVES as project manager, consultant or presales would be a plus.
* Strong communicator with good customer facing skills, able to interact effectively at all levels within customer organisations.
* Strong presentation skills and comfortable presenting in large audiences.
* Strong ability to listen and empathy.
* Knowledge of business process and practices in the requisite functional area.
* The ability to think creatively about business processes, map customer practices onto JEEVES, and to deliver effective solutions.
* The ability to work to deadlines, understanding the value and importance of milestone achievement.
Über Forterro


Forterro wurde 2012 gegründet und hat sich zu einem der führenden Anbieter von Industriesoftware entwickelt - mit Niederlassungen in den wichtigsten Produktionsländern Europas sowie regionalen Servicezentren und Entwicklungszentren auf der ganzen Welt. Von mehr als 40 Standorten aus stellen unsere über 1.700 Mitarbeiter Software für mehr als 13.000 Industrieunternehmen bereit und unterstützen diese. Unsere Produkte sind tief in den Anforderungen der jeweiligen Region verwurzelt. Jedes Produkt ist darauf ausgerichtet, die Fähigkeit unserer Kunden zu stärken und zu beschleunigen, effizient zu arbeiten und wettbewerbsfähig zu sein.

title: Shift Leader Front Office Scandic Gävle Väst
description:
**Nu söker vi en Shift Leader till Scandic Gävle Väst.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Som Shift Leader agerar du värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Under din tid hos oss kan dessa områden variera i takt med att du och affären utvecklas. Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad innebär rollen som Shift Leader Front Office?**



Du som arbetar inom Front Office är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning. Arbetet i Front Office innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet.



I rollen som Shift Leader har du, förutom att vara en del av driften, den övergripande överblicken över gästflödet och ser tillsammans med teamet till att prioritera arbetsuppgifter så att verksamheten flyter så att gästerna blir nöjda. Du leder och fördelar arbetet och hanterar bemanningen under ditt arbetspass. Vid behov får du utbilda nya medarbetare på hotellet och du avlastar också Front Office Manager med vissa administrativa arbetsuppgifter.



Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Din kompetens**



För den här rollen krävs att du har både förmåga och vilja att arbeta med ett driftsnära ledarskap. Du är trygg i ditt ledarskap och har både integritet och säljdriv. För att passa i rollen tror vi också att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster. Du är en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.



Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


**Information om tjänsten:**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!


Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

10963 Berlin

title: Marknadsspecialist (Livli Kungens Kurva)
description:
* **Job ID:** 285853
* **Date posted:** 14/04/2025
**VEM ÄR DU**  

Vill du vara med och skapa fantastiska upplevelser för våra besökare och partners på Livli galleria i Kungens Kurva? Är du redo för en rolig och spännande roll där du projektleder olika aktiviteter, event samt ansvarar för kundresans alla kontaktpunkter i ett omnichannel perspektiv.  

  

Hösten 2024 bytte vi namn till Livli, som var ett stort steg i vår förändringsresa från ett traditionellt köpcentrum till att bli en attraktiv mötesplats för de många människorna. Tillsammans med kollegorna och IKEA kommer du vara med och bidra i nästa spännande steg av de ambitiösa expansionsplanerna. I Kungens Kurva vid Ikoniska IKEA planerar vi för en hållbar urban stadsdel med plats för shopping, restauranger, nöjen samt bostäder och arbeten.  

  

  

  

Då vi är ett mindre team av olika personligheter så söker vi en kul, positiv och kommunikativ person som gillar att träffa nya människor och har lätt att knyta nya kontakter.
  

  

Du uppskattar att jobba i en värderingsstyrd organsation som värdesätter människors olikheter, månar om kollegorna och är prestigelös.
  

Du arbetar lika bra självständigt som tillsammans med andra där ditt fokus kommer vara att skapa, leda, utföra och följa upp olika marknadsföringsaktiviteter, event och kommunikation tillsammans med och under tillsammans med marknadschefen som blir din närmaste kollega.
  

  

Med fördel är du en person som kan strukturera och planera ditt eget arbete, är flexibel och gillar varierade arbetsdagar där helgarbete kan förekomma.
  

Du motiveras och inspireras av att vara i en miljö där du ständigt behöver förstå och anpassa dig efter de snabba förändringarna som sker i vår mötesplats & omvärld.
  

Dessutom vet du hur man:
  

  
* + använder digitala verktyg såsom Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop & Premiere Pro) samt Microsoft Office.
	+ Planerar, utför och följer upp effektiva marknadsaktiviteter, kampanjer och events utifrån marknadsplaner för att driva trafik till Livli.

Vi tror att du har några års erfarenhet från liknande roller med utbildning inom marknadsföring och kommunikation. Meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom kommersiell fastighet eller retail.  

  

För att lyckas i denna roll är det viktigt att du behärskar både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.  

**Att jobba med oss**  

I rollen som Marknadsspecialist är du ansvarig för att utföra uppgifter som stärker Livli i Kungens Kurva varumärke och blir en attraktiv plats som lockar fler besökare.
  

Några av dina arbetsuppgifter innefattar:
  

  
* + Ansvarig för kundresan, både digitalt och fysiskt. Samt stötta vår kundstrategi för att skapa en personlig kundresa genom alla kanaler på Livli.
	+ Ansvara för att planera, skapa, publicera och följa upp innehåll på sociala medier.
	+ Ansvara för att gallerians inredning och faciliteter känns nya och fräscha samt åtgärda, rapportera om någon inredning eller faciliteter behöver service eller renoveras.
	+ Ansvara för säsong och dekoration enligt varumärkes guidelines.
	+ Vara en god beställare av marknadsföring och kommunikation från olika byråer.
	+ Skapa marknadsföringsmaterial och kommunikation till trycksaker, digitala kanaler, (hemsida, sociala medier, nyhetsbrev) samt kundkommunikation utifrån satta guidelines.
**TILLSAMMANS SOM ETT TEAM**  

Ingka Centres skapar mötesplatser runt om i världen där människor kan mötas, uppleva och interagera, om och om igen. Tillsammans med IKEA och andra partners skapar vi ett komplett erbjudande för våra kunder och besökare, en miljö där de många människorna kan shoppa, äta, umgås och uppleva saker tillsammans.
  

Läs mer om oss här: www.ingkacentres.com  

  

Som Marknadsspecialist på Livli i Kungens Kurva är du en del av ett team som består av 5 personer som har tydliga ansvar och roller, men där vi alla stöttar och tar i där det behövs. Gemensamt arbetar vi för att skapa lyckade upplevelser och förutsättningar för både teamet, våra partners, våra kunder och besökare på Livli i Kungens Kurva!  

  

I denna tjänst kommer du vara baserad på Livli i Kungens Kurva, Huddinge. Du kommer rapportera till Meeting Place Manager – Yvonne Arentoft.
  

  

Som anställd hos oss kan vi bla erbjuda förmåner såsom, del i IKEA ONE Bonus, Friskvårdsbidrag, skobidrag, personalrabatt på IKEA samt en marknadsmässig lön.  

**Frågor och support? Låt oss knyta kontakt!**  

Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Marknadschef Joel Iden på joel.iden@ingka.com. Har du frågor kring rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Emelie Johansson, emelie.johansson@ingka.com  

  

Sista ansökningsdag är den 4 maj 2025. Vi tar emot ansökningar endast via vår jobbportal.  

  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Enterprise Architect | IKEA Marketing & Communication AB
description:
* **Job ID:** R0009765
* **Date posted:** 14/04/2025
**Company description*** Hej,
* The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people – and we’re always searching for new and better ways to do it. We use our home furnishing knowledge to create products and solutions that will enable more people to live the life they want. Through creativity, IKEA Marketing & Communication AB connects the heart of IKEA to the hearts and minds of the many people.
* We plan and produce inspiring content that enables our retail markets to grow and position IKEA as a purpose-led business and an expert in life at home. We are based in Älmhult, Sweden – the heart of IKEA. Our strength is our 400+ talented co-workers: strategists, channel experts, developers, photographers, motion media producers, 3D artists, graphic designers, copywriters, interior designers, and many more competences. We are proud of our craftsmanship and ability to unleash creativity at scale.
* The core of our offer is the common content made available to IKEA retailers around the globe. In addition, we offer market-specific content and on-request support to meet the needs of our markets. IKEA Marketing & Communication also develops the common marketing agenda for IKEA, leading in marketing and communication topics and contributing to our business strategies.
* Our culture and values guide us in everything we do. We become better as a team by building on our strengths and differences. Together, we strive for an inclusive work environment where we all feel safe, welcomed, respected, supported, and appreciated for who we are and what we contribute with.
* This is the place where you can inspire billions of people around the world. Are you ready to make a better everyday life for the many people? We want to hear from you!
* **We are now looking for an Enterprise architect to our Technology & Platform team at IMC IKEA Marketing & Communication Team in Älmhult. Do you want to join us?**
 **Job description*** We are looking for an Enterprise Architect with a strong focus on technology and an understanding of marketing and communication. In this role, you will be instrumental in defining and driving the next generation of our marketing and communication architecture. As part of the Technology & Platforms team within IKEA Marketing & Communication, you will directly support our core capabilities in marketing and communication. The Enterprise Architecture function is central to our transformational mission to boost engagement and amplify brand impact across diverse channels. In essence you will design, lead, organise, collaborate and communicate.
* You will:
* + Define and lead the Marketings & Communication architecture work. Setting the direction for digital platforms/products and technology enablers within the content supply chain.
	+ With and agile mindset, co-create and build the target state and provide roadmaps and incremental outcome focused transitions needed to reach the wanted position
	+ Secure architectural guidelines, design principles and lead architectural governance and anchoring through the organization
	+ Collaborate and align with stakeholders across the organization. From senior decision makers to the delivery teams in execution. Drive impact and influence through clear and structured presentations and communication
	+ Build relationship with external stakeholders like software vendors and drive technology discussions and assessment activities with them
	+ Besides your “daily” assignments you will get engaged in different opportunities and challenges across the organisation. Acting as a speaking partner and contributor on different topics, spanning from the strategic level to specific solutioning issues
* **About You**
* You are a tech-savvy problem solver with a passion for content creation, analytics and 3D technologies, thriving at the intersection of creative vision and technical execution. You bring a solid background in designing and maintaining systems that support content workflows, with experience in AI, data pipelines and analytics. Curious and forward-thinking, you are excited to explore new tools and methodologies to optimize content creation and visualization processes, keeping our systems innovative and future-ready.
* You work well both independently and as part of a collaborative team, balancing strategic insights with hands-on work. You are analytical, detail-oriented and able to handle complex fast-paced environments with both big-picture thinking and an eye for detail. Your communication skills and strategic mindset will be key as you work with cross-functional teams to align our architecture with the company’s vision for growth and creativity.
 **Qualification**  

* + Senior Experience: This is a senior role, so prior experience in similar responsibilities and familiarity with the marketing and communication domain is essential.
	+ Flexible Background: While an architectural background is not mandatory, experience in technology related role such as product leadership, engineering, technology strategy, or other digital functions.
	+ Interest in Architecture: An interest in architecture and an architectural mindset is important, even if formal experience in architecture is not required.
	+ Key Attributes: We value personality traits like ownership, leadership, relationship-building, clear communication, and stakeholder management at various levels.
	+ Broad Technology Scope: Beyond marketing & communication, this role covers a wide range of technology topics, including; Data & Analytics, Automation, 3D, AI & ML, Integrations, APIs & events, Standardization and Cloud Computing.
	+ Growt Mindset: We do not expect you to be an expert in all areas; there will be opportunities for upskilling, learning and growth as the role evolves.
 **More Information*** This is a permanent role based in Älmhult. We look forward to receiving your application, CV and motivation letter, in English, by 3rd of December. We really want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you want to work as Enterprise Architect at IMC and why you would be a good fit for this role. Please note that we are continuously interviewing candidates and may close the ad earlier.
* If you have questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact P&C recruiter: Timon Krommendam timon.krommendam@inter.ikea.com. If you have questions about the job, you are welcome to contact hiring manager: Martin Simicic martin.simicic@inter.ikea.com
* We do not accept applications sent via directly via email. Looking forward to hearing from you!
